166455543,cf_notices,fd9d1ebf-a977-4064-9601-f425da0fd672,ocds-0c46vo-0001-fd9d1ebf-a977-4064-9601-f425da0fd672,["tender"],en-GB,Brighter Futures project final evaluation,"We are inviting applications from providers who are able to undertake a final evaluation of the Big lottery/ESF funded Brighter Futures project. Using methods in line with industry recommended best practice, by undertaking desk-based analyses of a wide variety of project evidence and conducting surveys and interviews with a representative sample of stakeholders, staff, participants, the provider will evaluate the project in terms of its performance, impact and value for money. The provider will be expected to present their findings in a written report that includes lessons learned and future recommendations. The provider will also disseminate their findings through social media and through a presentation given at one internal and one external stakeholder event. A full description of the requirements is included in the attached specification and questionnaire document which is also available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities. If you are interested in supplying this provision, please complete the attached specification and questionnaire document and return to Rob Gray at rob@business2businesslimited.com by the submission deadline of 11.45pm on Friday 31st January 2020.

For all clarifications, please send written queries to rob@business2businesslimited.com. A response will be given within two working days of the query being raised. Within three working days of the query being made, the questions and answers document available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities will be updated with an anonymised version of the query and the given response. The deadline for queries relating to this specification is 5pm on Thursday 23rd January 2020.
Responses will be scored against fixed selection and award criteria.
The following selection criteria will be used:
•
column2: Organisational capacity

column1: •
column2: Economic and financial standing

column1: •
column2: Prior experience of service delivery

column1: Tenders that do not satisfy the above selection criteria will be de-selected from the procurement process.
The following Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) award criteria will be used to score tenders that satisfy the selection criteria:
•
column2: Price 20%

column1: •
column2: Merit of evaluation design 20%

column1: •
column2: Quality of plans to engage project participants and stakeholders 20%

column1: •
column2: Quality of the approach to be taken to calculating the social return on investment and local economic impact 20%

column1: •
column2: Merit of planned approach to disseminating the evaluation findings 20%

column1: The highest scoring tender will be the winning tender. Only information supplied by tenderers in response to the questions will be taken into account during the scoring process.
Please note that additional information may be requested as part of our due diligence procedures.

Brighter Futures (https://www.business2businesslimited.com/brighterfutures) is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support the holistic social inclusion of unemployed and economically inactive people aged 16+ within Leicester and Leicestershire. Delivered through a partnership of local organisations, the project is funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery, through the Big Lottery Fund.

The project began in December 2017 and was due to end in June 2020. However, a project extension granted by the Big Lottery and Leicester and Leicestershire LEP will enable the project to continue to meet the ongoing demand and need for support from local residents until Oct 2022.

167792338,cf_notices,bbd3ea07-adf0-4a40-b624-878708acf305,ocds-0c46vo-0001-bbd3ea07-adf0-4a40-b624-878708acf305,["tender"],en-GB,Cornwall Music Education Hub - Co-ordination & Delivery of school projects 2020/2021 - West Cornwall,"Cornwall Council, the lead partner of the Cornwall Music Education Hub (CMEH), seeks to contract a supplier to undertake to co-ordinate and deliver primary school projects in West Cornwall, as outlined in the delivery plan approved by The Arts Council.  Primarily the purpose of this work will be to support progression following First Access through targeted cluster projects, focusing on composition and playing of instruments.

The deliverer can be a self-employed individual, or a named individual from an organisation and will be responsible for working in conjunction with the CMEH Manager to ensure that CMEH is engaging with all Cornish schools (includes special and AP Academies).
Functions
•
column2: to support instrumental progression, especially after First Access

column1: •
column2: to deliver projects directly to students in cluster of schools, in conjunction with school staff

column1: •
column2: to encourage schools to provide the  opportunity to learn an instrument

column1: •
column2: to encourage schools to provide performance and ensemble opportunities

column1: •
column2: to increase staff confidence and skills in delivering music activity as part of project

Co-ordination & Delivery of school projects 2020/2021 - West Cornwall"", ""value"": {""amount"": 11000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""status"": ""unsuccessful"", ""minValue"": {""amount"": 11000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""documents"": [{""id"": ""tender_url"", ""url"": ""https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/bbd3ea07-adf0-4a40-b624-878708acf305"", ""format"": ""text/html"", ""language"": ""en"", ""documentType"": ""tenderNotice""}], ""milestones"": [{""id"": 1, ""title"": ""Contract start"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-04-01T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract start date""}, {""id"": 2, ""title"": ""Contract end"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2021-03-31T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""Cornwall Council, the lead partner of the Cornwall Music Education Hub (CMEH), seeks to contract a supplier to undertake to co-ordinate and deliver primary school projects in West Cornwall, as outlined in the delivery plan approved by The Arts Council.  Primarily the purpose of this work will be to support progression following First Access through targeted cluster projects, focusing on composition and playing of instruments. 

The deliverer can be a self-employed individual, or a named individual from an organisation and will be responsible for working in conjunction with the CMEH Manager to ensure that CMEH is engaging with all Cornish schools (includes special and AP Academies).

Functions
•	to support instrumental progression, especially after First Access
•	to deliver projects directly to students in cluster of schools, in conjunction with school staff
•	to encourage schools to provide the  opportunity to learn an instrument
•	to encourage schools to provide performance and ensemble opportunities
•	to increase staff confidence and skills in delivering music activity as part of project
•	to support schools with planning and delivering their music curriculum
•	to identify appropriate resources to support schools' needs 
•	to increase engagement with CMEH
•	to increase participation in music activity
Please see attached specification document"", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2020-01-30T00:00:00Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": false, ""isSuitableForVco"": true, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Services""}, ""procurementMethod"": null, ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Open procedure"", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T02:10:30.016161+00:00""}",2020-01-09 17:27:44.000000

193155153,cf_notices,fd3ad6c4-c163-420f-9154-5965967445ce,ocds-0c46vo-0001-fd3ad6c4-c163-420f-9154-5965967445ce,["tender"],en-GB,Q071 - Bolton Music & Performing Arts Centre Architectural Design Services,"The Borough Council of Bolton ("the Authority and/or Client") is prepared to receive tenders for Bolton Music & Performing Arts Centre Architectural Design Services which will be subject to the information, specification and tender package enclosed. his procurement exercise is being run as an open Invitation to Tender (ITT) and the Authority will appoint a single (1) contractor on the Contract. It is intended for the Contract to commence on 19 June 2020 and will end on 31 July 2020. To assist with its Future High Street Fund (FHSF) bid for Bolton town centre, the Borough Council of Bolton, (the "Client"), is seeking to appoint an architect (the "Consultant") to prepare RIBA Stage 2 plans for the Bolton Music & Performing Arts Centre. Please note, RIBA Stage 0 and Stage 1 have already been completed. This opportunity calls for innovative design proposals to create a new build, flagship cultural facility with the potential to have a transformational impact on Bolton Town Centre. It will be a place that responds to and captures Bolton's distinctive multi-cultural identity and enables the musical and broader educational and cultural life of the borough to grow. This enclosed document outlines: • The background to the brief • The site • The commission • Timetable and programme  The tender is available to apply via The Chest (www.the-chest.org.uk)",100000,GBP,2020-04-28 17:39:51.000000,2020-04-28 17:39:51.000000,2020-05-19 00:00:00.000000,The Borough Council of Bolton,3rd Floor Bolton Town Hall Victoria Square,Bolton,,BL1 1RU,England,Irfan Oomer,irfan.oomer@bolton.gov.uk,0,,,https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/fd3ad6c4-c163-420f-9154-5965967445ce,{71000000},2020-04-29 01:32:29.804035,2020-05-08 01:34:43.080188,"{""uri"": ""https://openopps.com/tenders/ocds-0c46vo-0001-fd3ad6c4-c163-420f-9154-5965967445ce/?format=json"", ""releases"": [{""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-95f45f60-0bb1-445c-94b1-a4ac777f7727-356278-bolt001-dn476275-32022359"", ""tag"": [""tender""], ""date"": ""2020-04-28T17:39:51Z"", ""ocid"": ""ocds-0c46vo-0001-fd3ad6c4-c163-420f-9154-5965967445ce"", ""buyer"": {""name"": ""The Borough Council of Bolton"", ""address"": {""region"": null, ""locality"": ""Bolton"", ""postalCode"": ""BL1 1RU"", ""countryName"": ""England"", ""streetAddress"": ""3rd Floor Bolton Town Hall Victoria Square""}, ""contactPoint"": {""uri"": ""http://www.bolton.gov.uk/"", ""name"": ""Irfan Oomer"", ""email"": ""irfan.oomer@bolton.gov.uk"", ""faxNumber"": null, ""telephone"": ""0""}}, ""tender"": {""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-95f45f60-0bb1-445c-94b1-a4ac777f7727-bolt001-dn476275-32022359"", ""items"": [{""id"": 1, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""71000000"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-71000000.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Architectural, construction, engineering and inspection services""}}], ""title"": ""Q071 - 192921166,cf_notices,e03df8fb-8915-4e08-84b8-d05e5285e2c6,ocds-0c46vo-0001-e03df8fb-8915-4e08-84b8-d05e5285e2c6,["tender"],en-GB,Thames Tideway Tunnel - C405 Main Works West - Hammersmith Inlet Channel Benching FRC Works,"The Thames Tideway Tunnel project (the Project) will control CSO discharges by intercepting and diverting combined sewage flows into a new storage and transfer tunnel. The main tunnel will run from Acton Storm Tanks in west London to Abbey Mills Pumping Station in the east, where it will connect to the Lee Tunnel, which will transfer the combined sewage to Beckton Sewage Treatment Works for treatment. The Project extends from Acton Storm Tanks in west London, to Abbey Mills Pumping Station in east London. The Project includes associated works at Beckton STW, Shad Thames Pumping Station and Bekesbourne Street.
The geographic layout of the Project and local authorities through which it passes is shown in Figure 1.
The Project comprises:
a. tunnels:

i. a main tunnel which will capture and store combined sewage from CSOs along its route and transfer it to Abbey Mills Pumping Station, from where the Lee Tunnel will transfer it for treatment at Beckton Sewage Treatment Works
ii. 11 connection tunnels, which will link flows from CSOs to the main tunnel.
b. Worksites:
i. five main tunnel Worksites (drive and/or reception sites)
ii. 16 CSO Worksites
iii. two System modification Worksites Thames Tideway Tunnel
iv. works at Beckton Sewage Treatment works.
Scope of Works

The Hammersmith Pumping Station (HAMPS) Inlet Channel forms part of a live sewage pumping station infrastructure. It will remain operational throughout the duration of the project. This is a gravity-fed storm relief pumping station, with no physical or mechanical means of isolating the two sewers entering the Inlet Channel wet weather, thus all works are weather-dependent.

In order to ensure safety of the working teams, BMB have implemented a series of real-time catchment sewer monitoring along with computer modelling and weather forecast modelling tools which form part of the safe system of works (more details can be provided on request). Within the Inlet Channel, two temporary weir walls were installed, which are interconnected with a series of flumes to divert the flows through the works area (referred to as dry zone), effectively creating a cofferdam within the sewer environment
BMB JV are required to construct 4no elements of additional benching structures within the HAMPS Inlet Channel (highlighted in Figure 2), as follows:

column2: Benching constructed on top of the base slab - 8m log, 2m wide (at base) with the outer face sloping towards the north wall at 45o, 750mm high. The subcontractor is to design, supply and install the formwork for this element. B16 dowels and face tension reinforcement bars (at 150mm c/c) will be supplied by BMB but will need cutting / bending and fixing by the subcontractor - no reinforcement drg is available at this stage but it is envisaged to have less than 100mm B16 bars.

Mass section of mass benching on top of the existing wall benching - upstream of the temporary weir wall. The section will have curved faces - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.

Mass section of mass benching on top of the existing wall benching - upstream of the temporary weir wall. The section will have curved faces - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.

Bullnose' mass benching installed on top of the existing slab, against the wall section between the two sewer portals. This section will be curved in multiple directions - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.

column1: Please note that entry upstream of the upstream temporary weir wall (items 2 and 3) is only possible during the safe tide window (+/- 2hrs from the low tide at Hammersmith) - a spreadsheet with exact tides for May and July was attached for reference. As north wall benching (item 1) is not restricted to low tide working, the Subcontractor's programme should allow for overlapping the activities such the low tide window is used for the upstream works and the remainder of the shift can be used for constructing Item 1 benching as well as all enabling works.
Returned quotations will be evaluated by BMB JV's (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty) Procurement team in conjunction with our design and engineering teams.
Quotations will be evaluated based on;
Cost
Timeliness of return
Adherence to and demonstration of understanding of the drawings and specifications provided at this point.
Provision of accurate product specifications to accompany the quotation.
Supplier experience of similar projects,evidence of this will be requested should the initial quotation be of interest.
Should the candidate supplier be shortlisted they will then be contacted directly by a member of the BMB Procurement Team within two weeks of shortlisting to discuss the requirement in detail.
BMB Joint Venture (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty)
Hammersmith Site

179850945,cf_notices,2e3c002f-b7de-409d-910b-d33a307107a7,ocds-0c46vo-0001-2e3c002f-b7de-409d-910b-d33a307107a7,["tender"],en-GB,Running Event Organisation and Operating Services,"The Slough Borough Council (The Authority) Half Marathon was organised and delivered by the council in October 2018.  Due to the pressures of organising and delivering the event, it was decided that the most appropriate and efficient way to deliver this event in the future would be to outsource the event to a professional organiser (the Service Provider).
The contract will be for 3 years with an option to extend for two further periods of 1 year each.
The event will take place on a Sunday morning between the 20th September to 11th October 2020 and equivalent periods in any subsequent year.
The Event must cater for at least 1000 participants.

The Service Provider must ensure that they are United Kingdom Athletics (UKA) Licensed and will comply with UKA Guidelines throughout the event as defined at https://www.runbritain.com/shared/get-file.ashx?itemtype=document&id=1930

The Service Provider is solely responsible for its costs in operating the event and the Council will not provide any funding or subsidy to the Service Provider beyond the provision of its staff for the performance of the Council's duties in relation to the planning or running of the event.",0,GBP,2020-03-02 17:40:57.000000,,2020-03-27 00:00:00.000000,SE Shared Services,51 Bath Road 179850941,cf_notices,d8c8ba88-d8db-4b89-bc74-0fb1af138bb5,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d8c8ba88-d8db-4b89-bc74-0fb1af138bb5,["tender"],en-GB,Inward Investment Services,"The draft Kent and Medway Enterprise and Productivity Strategy places a strong emphasis on the importance of attracting inward investment, and for locally based agencies to work closely with government agencies to bring new investment into the area. The draft Strategy places a strong emphasis on increasing our promotion of Kent and Medway as a UK inward investment gateway, with a commitment required from Government and the Department for International Trade (DIT) to match local support for inward investment where it is focused around sectors in which Kent and Medway have particular strengths.

Kent County Council is seeking a supplier that can be the inward investment agency for Kent and Medway. The successful supplier must have an excellent understanding of the key issues companies face when looking to relocate, an understanding of the industrial and commercial property market in Kent and Medway, how to identify and develop leads, how to support companies during the relocation process, and how to support relocated companies following relocation. The successful supplier should have a strong track record of delivering similar services. The core of the contract will be to provide support to SMEs, in accordance with the requirements of ESIF Programme, but the successful candidate will also be required to support non-SMEs. This part of the contract will not be funded by ERDF. The successful supplier will be expected to deliver, alongside Kent County Council and Medway Council, specific outcomes that contribute to economic development in Kent and Medway and will work closely with stakeholders in the county and internationally, including DIT and the South East Local Enterprise Partnership. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will perform this role, and to show a proven track record in such delivery. The successful supplier will develop innovative and creative solutions to secure inward investment in Kent and Medway.

The key features of the service are; Securing external investment into Kent and Medway that creates new jobs; Promoting Kent and Medway to overseas markets; Maintaining close contact with investing businesses through an after-care programme. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will deliver these. The successful supplier will also demonstrate how it will deliver and contribute to the following economic outcomes for Kent and Medway: More investment opportunities from overseas markets; Increased supply chain benefits for local businesses; More inward investment in Kent and Medway; Raised profile as a destination for inward and foreign direct investment.
The Selection Questionnaire consists of a range of pass/fail questions, only Candidates who meet the minimum criteria will proceed to receive the Tender process.

This notice is placed in consideration of The Public Contract Regulations, Regulation 32 (9) to (12), subject to additional funding being made available during the lifetime of the a strong emphasis on the importance of attracting inward investment, and for locally based agencies to work closely with government agencies to bring new investment into the area. The draft Strategy places a strong emphasis on increasing our promotion of Kent and Medway as a UK inward investment gateway, with a commitment required from Government and the Department for International Trade (DIT) to match local support for inward investment where it is focused around sectors in which Kent and Medway have particular strengths. 

Kent County Council is seeking a supplier that can be the inward investment agency for Kent and Medway. The successful supplier must have an excellent understanding of the key issues companies face when looking to relocate, an understanding of the industrial and commercial property market in Kent and Medway, how to identify and develop leads, how to support companies during the relocation process, and how to support relocated companies following relocation. The successful supplier should have a strong track record of delivering similar services. The core of the contract will be to provide support to SMEs, in accordance with the requirements of ESIF Programme, but the successful candidate will also be required to support non-SMEs. This part of the contract will not be funded by ERDF. The successful supplier will be expected to deliver, alongside Kent County Council and Medway Council, specific outcomes that contribute to economic development in Kent and Medway and will work closely with stakeholders in the county and internationally, including DIT and the South East Local Enterprise Partnership. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will perform this role, and to show a proven track record in such delivery. The successful supplier will develop innovative and creative solutions to secure inward investment in Kent and Medway. 

The key features of the service are; Securing external investment into Kent and Medway that creates new jobs; Promoting Kent and Medway to overseas markets; Maintaining close contact with investing businesses through an after-care programme. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will deliver these. The successful supplier will also demonstrate how it will deliver and contribute to the following economic outcomes for Kent and Medway: More investment opportunities from overseas markets; Increased supply chain benefits for local businesses; More inward investment in Kent and Medway; Raised profile as a destination for inward and foreign direct investment. 

The Selection Questionnaire consists of a range of pass/fail questions, only Candidates who meet the minimum criteria will proceed to receive the Tender process.

179850953,cf_notices,a755c92c-cbf4-429b-b9d6-f60a477225a0,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a755c92c-cbf4-429b-b9d6-f60a477225a0,["tender"],en-GB,Tonge Start Well Centre Early Education and Childcare Opportunity,"In Bolton our aim is to ensure the best outcomes for children by making sure the free early years places are delivered safely and to a consistently high standard. We will work collaboratively with providers and parents to offer families high quality provision.
Applications are invited to set up high quality childcare provision in the following building:
Tonge Start Well Centre
Starkie Road,
Bolton
BL2 2ED

Bolton Start Well Service (the "Service") is offering an opportunity for a suitable early education and childcare provider (the "Provider") to run on-site sustainable, high-quality provision in the dedicated nursery section of the Tonge Start Well Centre.

Tonge Start Well Centre is an excellent location for a nursery setting, serving housing estates in the Tonge area. It is in one of the more disadvantaged areas of Bolton and will attract funding for eligible two year old children. Tonge Start Well Centre offers a range of activities and integrated support services to support families with parenting so children get the best start in life. A wide range of services are offered from the centre including Antenatal and Well Baby Clinics; Stay and Play sessions, community activity and Tonge Church. It is also close to local shops, post office, doctors, dentist and a number of primary schools. The building benefits from good transport links and is only ten minutes out of Bolton Town Centre ensuring good access for families.

The Provider will be offered a dedicated nursery unit, with toilets, office, storage space and shared use of the kitchen (with specified storage space). The property has recently been decorated including new flooring. There are purpose built toilets and sinks for the children.
The building benefits from a large car park and secure outdoor play space which has a grass and tarmac areas. This is fenced / gated and will be for exclusive use by the nursery.
The Service is therefore inviting expressions of interest from good and outstanding providers who wish to deliver a quality service within the building.

There is an open session to view the building on Wednesday 11 March 2020, 18:00hrs.",0,GBP,2020-03-02 18:15:43.000000,,2020-03-23 00:00:00.000000,Bolton Council,3rd Floor Bolton Town Hall Victoria 179850949,cf_notices,78a2f658-22f5-45ea-a24d-bd4084f508d9,ocds-0c46vo-0001-78a2f658-22f5-45ea-a24d-bd4084f508d9,["tender"],en-GB,"Catering Services for Cafe at Anglia Ruskin University's Guild House campus, Peterborough","Anglia Ruskin University is seeking a catering partner to provide catering services for the Cafe at their Guild House campus in Peterborough, which is a dedicated health, education and social care campus.As part of ARU's future vision and strategy, it is expanding their partnering relationships.Catering at Guild House is currently proved by PRC Ventures based at Peterborough College.  The facilities provide a small cafe on the top floor that is supported by an open kitchen.  Current turnover is approx GPB 21k per annum, and is a 12 month a year operation.  ARU pay a capped subsidy of GBP 1.5k per month to the incumbent to cover the cost of service.The opportunity is for a fixed term two year contract from 1st July 2020 to 1st July 2022 and may be the start of a more progressive partnership with ARU.Current opening hours are 08:30 to 16:00, but the University would consider 09:30 to 15:30 for a justifiable business case.   We are advised TUPE will not apply, but interested parties will be informed of this as the opportunity prevails.A tender for this requirement will be released by 28 Feb 2020. The successful organisation will be required to commence services on 01.07.20. A tender meeting and site visit is being held on 05.03.20 at Guild House (PE2 9PW). Please see Additional Information for more details and register your interest via Panache Consultancy at email -  gailheath@panacheconsultancy.co.uk by midday 03.03.20 if of interest.ARU are looking specifically for:1)
column2: A bread based offer with a small selection of hot food items such as pastries, pies, soup, baked potatoes, etc.2)
column3: An attractive facility that is welcoming, offers choice with attentive customer service.3)
column4: Healthy choices that are attractive to the student base at Peterborough campus.4)
column7: Hospitality and internal delivered services when requested.7)
column8: Reliability of service provision and cover in team absences.8)
column9: Client value for money through the subsidy.9)
column10: Contractor incentivised management fee to help generate success.There is no need for capital investment, although Tenderers may be interested in supporting the services through additional equipment/concept supply.",0,GBP,2020-03-02 17:45:08.000000,,2020-03-30 00:00:00.000000,Anglia Ruskin University,Guild House Campus ,Peterborough,,PE2 179851041,cf_notices,fbfbb64c-a97d-4da4-96ff-457ffc5f87ec,ocds-0c46vo-0001-fbfbb64c-a97d-4da4-96ff-457ffc5f87ec,["tender"],en-GB,Independent Evaluator: Croydon Community Partnership Against Trauma,"The successful vendor will join the Croydon Community Partnership Against Trauma (CCPAT).  CCPAT is one of many projects that is key to Croydon's long-term strategy to reduce youth violence by building partnerships that bring families, schools and local communities together in an integrated programme that equips young people with the tools to overcome a range of adverse childhood experiences and the skills to achieve their goals.
The specific role of the vendor will be to independently evaluate the efficacy of a three year project.
The successful vendor will participate in an exercise to finalise KPIs - including commenting on baselines and ongoing targets.
They will also provide annual analysis of standardised performance information, including comparison to one or more control group.
The successful vendor will also provide an end of project report.

Project Description: Full details relating to the Works are provided in the tender documents. To participate, Suppliers will need to Register as a Supplier with ProContract, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, then Register an Interest before obtaining access to the tender documents. In the event of difficulties registering as a supplier, please refer to the System Administrator Proactis support team at ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com Contract Period: The contract will be initially for a period of 2 months commencing May 2020. Tender Responses: Tender responses are required to be submitted via email (including the project name clearly in the e-mail title) to hppd@swindon.gov.uk by no later than 27th March 2020 at 12:00 hrs UK local time. Tender Clarifications: If you require any clarifications on the tender documents, please submit these in writing via e-mail (including the project name clearly in the e-mail title) to hppd@swindon.gov.uk by 18th March 2020 at 12.00 UK local time. The Council's responses to these clarification questions will be issued periodically on the ProContract tender portal. Please note that Supplying the South West Portal is the only portal that includes all the relevant documents required to respond to this opportunity (Project Id: DN169221). No Tender submissions will be considered without completing the tender documents in full including attachments and returning them in alignment with the instructions within the tender This accommodates for the valuation and reporting for new build schemes. As well as our Buyback programme and Right to Buy / Acquire properties.
Lot 1 - Land, Sales and Rental Values
Lot 2 - Buyback properties; Right to Buy/Acquire Properties; Annual Rent Review.

179851102,cf_notices,154853df-d1ea-40cf-b57e-5927afd33406,ocds-0c46vo-0001-154853df-d1ea-40cf-b57e-5927afd33406,["tender"],en-GB,"PROVISION OF REHABILITATION, REABLEMENT AND TRANSITIONAL CARE IN A CARE HOME","Hartlepool Borough Council, in collaboration with the Stockton & Hartlepool CCG, seeks to commission a rehabilitation, renablement and transitional care service through the block purchase of 20 beds in a designated unit within a registered care home in Hartlepool.

The service will be available to all adults over the age of 18 and be inclusive of older people with a dementia. It will target people who would otherwise face unnecessarily prolonged hospital stays, inappropriate hospital admission or long term residential care.
The service will commence on 1st June 2020 for a period of 3 years

179851124,cf_notices,bc8f45ed-47e6-40a8-b1e5-0bfe707e36de,ocds-0c46vo-0001-bc8f45ed-47e6-40a8-b1e5-0bfe707e36de,["tender"],en-GB,Quotation for ICT Print Unit   MIS Replacement System,"OVERVIEW

The Central Print Unit provides a printing resource and processes requests from various sections of Sandwell MBC, external companies and local members.  The orders vary from 1 print request to thousands.

The system currently used is 20 + years old and has not been supported for several years.  It runs on Vista and is not compatible with the current Windows Operating system & Office 365.  No back-ups are taken.
There is a requirement to replace this existing system so that it is compliant with the current ICT infrastructure and security.

The replacement system is to be supplied on an initial 2-year contract with the option to extend for up to a further 2 years, with full support and maintenance. Applicants are required to submit prices for the initial contract period and the optional extension period.

column1: The provision of integrated offline and online media buying services for the Anchor Hanover Group.

column2: Deliverables

column1: The media agency shall support Anchor Hanover to effectively buy, measure and report offline and online media for its Group product portfolio. 179623221,cf_notices,ec08ed91-e1b8-434f-8fde-534f0e6752da,ocds-0c46vo-0001-ec08ed91-e1b8-434f-8fde-534f0e6752da,["tender"],en-GB,On-boarding process for Care Homes,"NHS Kernow and the Council are pleased to invite care home providers to join the new joint contract for Care Home services from April 2020.

As statutory commissioning authorities we are required under the Public Contract Regulations (2015) to ensure we use a compliant process for purchasing services. In order to balance this with our duties under the Patient Choice Regulations (2013) and the Care Act (2014), we have developed a bespoke process for care home services in Cornwall. This is intended to ensure a clear and straightforward process that will not preclude registered providers from joining the new contractual arrangements.

179172475,cf_notices,45370c78-19df-4ae1-b710-a601f06f09f4,ocds-0c46vo-0001-45370c78-19df-4ae1-b710-a601f06f09f4,["tender"],en-GB,Transport Modeller Recruitment,"The Department for Transport (DfT) invites proposals for a Recruitment Agency/Consultancy with proven expertise of recruiting Senior Transport Modellers to join DfTs Appraisal and Strategic Analysis team based in London. The department has two Senior Transport Modeller vacancies that need filling.

The full tender document pack, including the role profile, will be accessible through DfTs AWARD e-Sourcing portal. DfT will issue the AWARD e-Sourcing portal registration to Tenderers requested through Contracts Finder. To permit this, tenderers will be required to register onto the e-Sourcing portal for this specific requirement. To register, please send an email detailing company name, the full name of the requestor and an email address to Costaki.costi@dft.gov.uk
The tender submission deadline is 25 March 2020.

179172476,cf_notices,f0cc67a6-8203-491e-8940-36944342d90c,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f0cc67a6-8203-491e-8940-36944342d90c,["tender"],en-GB,Homes England - Peterborough Town Sites Landscape Maintenance and Cleansing Contract 2020 - 2023,"Homes England is currently seeking to appoint a competent Supplier for the provision of landscape maintenance and cleansing services within the Peterborough area. There are currently 11 sites within Homes England's Peterborough portfolio. The Sites vary in size and character, and include public open space, land reserved for future development and residual land left over from residential and commercial development. The contract is envisaged to have duration of 2 years with provision for a further 1 year extension under the same Terms and Conditions of this contract. Any contract extensions will be based on tendered Rates and Prices. Typical planned Services under this contract comprise of but are not exclusively limited to the following: Site inspections, whereby the Supplier shall indicate; all matters relating to the maintenance specification, recommendations for necessary Service, incidences of vandalism, fly tipping, trespass and adjustments to the scheduled Service; Grass Cutting; Hedge Cutting; Weed Control; and Cleansing. 179172477,cf_notices,d199306f-be84-4fa0-941e-d3e816f71166,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d199306f-be84-4fa0-941e-d3e816f71166,["tender"],en-GB,UK SBS CR20024 - Entrepreneurial-University Eco-system: Scoping: Sector Characteristics - Pharmaceuticals,"The final date and time for the submission of bids is Tuesday, 17th March 2020.
DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.
All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.
Brief Description of Requirement

This study is focussed on the Pharmaceuticals sector, and there are two other sector studies - on fintech and fashion - being commissioned separately. The three sector studies are intended to be based upon deep experience and insight of the specific sector being examined.   The three sector studies, and a separate quantitative study on sizing the overall opportunity in the deep dive being commissioned separately, will all inform next steps.  Work in this stage takes account of the SQW technical note, which suggested the likely scale and wide range needed in a deep dive, and hence the need to consider carefully scope and methodology.
Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal.
This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the ITQ  document.
How to Apply
UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement.
To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and the follow the instructions to 'Login'
Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 4DZS4S5978

179172422,cf_notices,65a27982-6f33-4a8f-9c51-99f8c083f595,ocds-0c46vo-0001-65a27982-6f33-4a8f-9c51-99f8c083f595,["tender"],en-GB,Living Well @ Home (regulated home based care/domiciliary care),"The Trust intends to let a pseudo Framework Agreement under Regulations 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (Light Touch Regime).  The Trust are seeking to contract with a number of home care Providers through a pseudo open framework agreement from 1st April 2020 for 5 years with the option to extend for a further 3 years.  We currently purchase circa 7,000 hours per week and we need to develop our market to fill outstanding packages of care. We anticipate opening the procurement annually/as and when required for new applicants and/or lots, extending the scope beyond standard home based care/domiciliary care.  The Trust is issuing an Invitation to Participate ahead of the final specifications and confirmation of rates.  This will allow potential Providers to familiarising themselves with the relevant Selection Questionnaire and Award Criteria Questions. At a later date the Trust will issue the final specification and rates, and then set the date and time for the closure of this Contract Notice. We will provide potential Providers a reasonable amount of time to formalise their response.  Complimentary Information: The Trust intends to let a pseudo Framework Agreement under Regulations 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (Light Touch Regime).",8000000,GBP,2020-02-28 Framework Agreement under Regulations 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (Light Touch Regime).  The Trust are seeking to contract with a number of home care Providers through a pseudo open framework agreement from 1st April 2020 for 5 years with the option to extend for a further 3 years.  We currently purchase circa 7,000 hours per week and we need to develop our market to fill outstanding packages of care. We anticipate opening the procurement annually/as and when required for new applicants and/or lots, extending the scope beyond standard home based care/domiciliary care.  The Trust is issuing an Invitation to Participate ahead of the final specifications and confirmation of rates.  This will allow potential Providers to familiarising themselves with the relevant Selection Questionnaire and Award Criteria Questions. At a later date the Trust will issue the final specification and rates, and then set the date and time for the closure of this Contract Notice. 178938520,cf_notices,f9482c45-3afb-4431-a20c-91b53f623e2e,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f9482c45-3afb-4431-a20c-91b53f623e2e,["tender"],en-GB,Supply of Traffic Cameras and Image Hosting Service,"This Framework is for supply of Cameras Associated Equipment and an Image Hosting & Support Service for Traffic Monitoring within the County of Durham.

Durham County Council is seeking to appoint a single supplier.  If you are successful you will be appointed to the Framework.  Following appointment the Council may make call-offs against the Framework Agreement on the basis of you being the sole supplier on the Framework and you will be expected to respond to meet the demand of the Council's planned programme.  However, should you be unable to meet the requirements of any order then the Council reserves the right to approach other contractors to carry out such order.

Details of the NHS Supply chain routes to market can be found in Appendix 4b operational requirements of suppliers.

The framework agreement is for a range of syringes, needles and associated products. Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that that in the first 12 months of the framework agreement the value of purchases will be in the region of circa of 60 000 000 GBP however this is approximate only and the values may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the framework agreement. 178715480,cf_notices,da3235c5-6478-42c8-a325-98509644c6d7,ocds-0c46vo-0001-da3235c5-6478-42c8-a325-98509644c6d7,["tender"],en-GB,WSCC DR Public Health Services Re-Opening,"A contract for the provision of Public Health Services, as described in Documents 2a - g (Service Specification) ("the Contract") is being re-opened for further tendered by West Sussex County Council ("the Council") in accordance with the Light Touch Regime (LTR) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) ("the 2015 Regulations").

The aim of the procurement process is to seek additional service providers to provide Public Health Services in the County of West Sussex. As such, please note that bidders will not be competing with each other for a place on this contract. All bidders who pass the evaluation stage, as detailed in Parts 3 and 4 below will be offered a place on the approved supplier list.
The procurement process will be undertaken using the OJEU Open Procedure and will be divided into the following six lots:
Lot 1: NHS Health Check Services
Lot 2: Smoking Cessation Services
Lot 3: Alcohol Identification and Brief Advice Services
Lot 4: Intrauterine Device Services
Lot 5: Contraceptive Implant Services

Lot 6: Emergency Hormonal Contraception Services",6500000,GBP,2020-02-26 10:47:34.000000,,2020-03-27 00:00:00.000000,SE Shared Services,West Street Chicester,West Sussex,,PO19 1RQ,United Kingdom,David 173891673,cf_notices,fb0d7feb-c573-4840-8a7b-0995cec89654,ocds-0c46vo-0001-fb0d7feb-c573-4840-8a7b-0995cec89654,["tender"],en-GB,Group Collaboration Software Solution,"2428.454.JT.AMRC.19        Group Collaboration Software Solution
The University of Sheffield wishes to invite tenders for a Group Collaboration Software Solution on behalf of the Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre,  Catcliffe, South Yorkshire.
Scope of Requirement

The Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre (AMRC) is seeking to establish a contract for the provision of a Group Collaboration Software Solution (GCSS). The introduction of a GCSS will assist the AMRC in achieving its strategic objectives by creating a collaboration hub, which will provide fast and efficient group-wide communication with real time messaging and data transfer.
Tender Process and Documentation:

This procurement is an EU open procedure conducted in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.
Closing date for receipt of tenders: 6th March 2020 at 12 Noon (UK time).

176640013,cf_notices,1b8da98c-86a4-4243-92cf-d0d6b939d14b,ocds-0c46vo-0001-1b8da98c-86a4-4243-92cf-d0d6b939d14b,["tender"],en-GB,Forest School and Nursery - Staffordshire University,"Staffordshire University are investing in a new purpose built day care nursery with additional capacity for a classroom and observational suite with leading digital technology. It is also proposed as part of the new nursery provision to take the opportunity to incorporate a 'forest school' facility together with associated ground works around the nature reserve. This will support student retention, provide additional surplus income, attract and engage potential students, staff and community.

176640092,cf_notices,c4d7e60e-331d-456d-bb7b-16dc471708ac,ocds-0c46vo-0001-c4d7e60e-331d-456d-bb7b-16dc471708ac,["tender"],en-GB,Independent visitor services for children looked after,"The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is seeking bids for provision of Independent Visitor Service for Children Looked After.

Independent Visitors provide a support and befriending service to children and young people who are in care. This service originated in the 1989 Children Act for children who had little or no contact with their birth family. However, changes to the statutory guidance in the 2008 Act now mean that any young person in care is now eligible for this service if it appears to be in the child's interests to do so.
The contract will commence on 1st August 2020 and be for a period of three years with an option to extend on a one plus one (1 + 1) basis at the sole discretion of the Council.

provision of Independent Visitor Service for Children Looked After.

Independent Visitors provide a support and befriending service to children and young people who are in care. This service originated in the 1989 Children Act for children who had little or no contact with their birth family. However, changes to the statutory guidance in the 2008 Act now mean that any young person in care is now eligible for this service if it appears to be in the child's interests to do so. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                               The contract will commence on 1st August 2020 and be for a period of three years with an option to extend on a one plus one (1 + 1) basis at the sole discretion of the Council.

176640031,cf_notices,3c1a72c0-2d1c-4fe4-8b57-d39a74074839,ocds-0c46vo-0001-3c1a72c0-2d1c-4fe4-8b57-d39a74074839,["tender"],en-GB,Bus Timetabling and Publicity ICT system,"Across the borough there is over 2,278 bus stops, of which 1,593 locations have public transport information displayed.  Real Time Passenger Information is provided at Chester Bus Interchange and on-street in Forgeate Street, Chester Railway station and very soon in Northwich. The Council is committed to ensuring that Public Transport is more attractive and is easier to use in the future. Getting people to the right place at the right time is essential to the smooth operation of any transport network.

column2: What we are buying and why

column1: A bus timetabling and publicity ICT solution.
2.3 What we require: the solution

The Strategic Transport team is customer focused and committed to delivering an excellent service to its residents in the provision of public transport information across the borough. This is successfully achieved through maintaining roadside information at bus stops, producing timetables leaflets and travel information for bus stations, alongside providing regular updates to Traveline.  The system must be intuitive and flexible to ensure the efficient delivery of public transport at a local or national.
The Council has embraced a cloud-first approach as part of its IT strategy and prefer where possible, the sourcing of solutions that will be offered to the customer as Software as a Service (SaaS).

176640045,cf_notices,441ff3cc-4a62-45f1-9196-a14418c22e41,ocds-0c46vo-0001-441ff3cc-4a62-45f1-9196-a14418c22e41,["tender"],en-GB,Labour Services,"EEM are looking to establish a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) to engage a range of providers that are able to deliver a diverse range of Labour Services and Associated Works; the categories of services are as follows;
Electricians
Joiners/Carpenters
Plasterers
Plumbers
Heating Engineers
Painters/Decorators
Multi Skilled Operatives
Submissions to join the DPS can be made at any time and will remain open for application for 5 years and will operate through the Geometra Portal.

This DPS has been created for EEM Members to directly employ additional trade labour to assist their in house teams or any Contractor with their resources on an adhoc and short-term scale. This DPS is not suitable for recruitment agencies.
The procurement process will be run in accordance with the following programme:
First Mini Tenders released from: 06.04.2020.
DPS end date: 28.03.2025.

The organisations that are successful in being awarded a place on the DPS will be given a "pre-approved"status and will be invited to submit a formal bid when EEM Members have a requirement to contract the work stream associated with this DPS. Each application to join the DPS will be reviewed by EEM to ensure the minimum criteria for entry onto the DPS is met. The minimum criteria for entry onto the DPS are detailed in Online Supplier Selection Questionnaire Evaluation.

EEM Members are currently located throughout England and Wales and as such opportunities arising from this DPS will be in various geographical areas. For a full update list of the current EEM members please visit www.eem.org.uk

Please note that the total potential value stated in II.2.6) is for the full 5-year DPS period and takes into consideration that the EEM membership may grow over the life of the DPS period. No guarantees are given for values and volumes.

This DPS is being established by Efficiency East Midlands Ltd ("EEM") on behalf of their members and the other organisations described below as being Authorised Users. The following Contracting Authorities will be entitled to agree and award contracts through the DPS system:
1) Any Member of EEM. A full list of current Members is available at www.eem.org.uk
2) Any future Member of EEM, and in all cases being an organisation which has applied to join EEM in accordance with the applicable constitutional documents;

""description"": ""EEM are looking to establish a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) to engage a range of providers that are able to deliver a diverse range of Labour Services and Associated Works; the categories of services are as follows;
Electricians
Joiners/Carpenters
Plasterers
Plumbers
Heating Engineers
Painters/Decorators
Multi Skilled Operatives
Submissions to join the DPS can be made at any time and will remain open for application for 5 years and will operate through the Geometra Portal.
This DPS has been created for EEM Members to directly employ additional trade labour to assist their in house teams or any Contractor with their resources on an adhoc and short-term scale. This DPS is not suitable for recruitment agencies.
The procurement process will be run in accordance with the following programme:
First Mini Tenders released from: 06.04.2020.
DPS end date: 28.03.2025.

The organisations that are successful in being awarded a place on the DPS will be given a "pre-approved"status and will be invited to submit a formal bid when EEM Members have a requirement to contract the work stream associated with this DPS. Each application to join the DPS will be reviewed by EEM to ensure the minimum criteria for entry onto the DPS is met. The minimum criteria for entry onto the DPS are detailed in Online Supplier Selection Questionnaire Evaluation.

EEM Members are currently located throughout England and Wales and as such opportunities arising from this DPS will be in various geographical areas. For a full update list of the current EEM members please visit www.eem.org.uk
Please note that the total potential value stated in II.2.6) is for the full 5-year DPS period and takes into consideration that the EEM membership may grow over the life of the DPS period. No guarantees are given for values and volumes.
This DPS is being established by Efficiency East Midlands Ltd ("EEM") on behalf of their members and the other organisations described below as being Authorised Users. The following Contracting Authorities will be entitled to agree and award contracts through the DPS system:
1) Any Member of EEM. A full list of current Members is available at www.eem.org.uk
2) Any future Member of EEM, and in all cases being an organisation which has applied to join EEM in accordance with the applicable constitutional documents;
3) An EEM Participant being an organisation which is neither a current or EEM Member (as defined at 1 above)nor a Future Member of EEM (as defined at 2 above) based within England and Wales which owns and/or maintains/manages housing stock in 1 or more geographic area in which it operates and/or is an NHS Trust(which includes Acute Trusts, Mental Trusts, Care Services Trusts and Ambulance Trusts) or organisation,police authority, fire authority, ambulance trust, university, higher education, further education college, school academy or other public sector organisation."", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2025-03-26T00:00:00Z"", ""startDate"": ""2020-02-17T09:05:10Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": true, ""isSuitableForVco"": false, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Services""}, ""procurementMethod"": ""selective"", ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Restricted procedure (OJEU)"", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T01:33:57.832119+00:00""}",2020-02-17 09:05:10.000000

176640054,cf_notices,7f83207f-4054-4e00-824d-2bf42cdcd207,ocds-0c46vo-0001-7f83207f-4054-4e00-824d-2bf42cdcd207,["tender"],en-GB,Executive Sensei Programme - NHS Executive Lean Coaching and Mentoring,"NHS Trust Development Authority requires delivery of expert coaching and mentoring (Executive Sensei) support to NHS Chief Executive's and Boards to augment their Lean development as part of the Vital Signs Programme.

Vital Signs is a programme to enable an NHS Improvement Practice to help transform and continuously improve the delivery of what patients want and value with the best use of resources founded on Lean Principles and Systems Thinking to promote improvement stream unification around a common target of an NHS Improvement Practice. Vital Signs is a learning network to support all those on the improvement journey in the NHS no matter their starting point, current position, improvement model, or coach/sensei.
Please visit the Mytenders portal to download the tender documents.https://www.mytenders.co.uk/Default.aspx
The Mytenders reference for this requirement is FEB159285

176640048,cf_notices,a262a68d-18e5-468f-a5eb-b035e53b14ff,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a262a68d-18e5-468f-a5eb-b035e53b14ff,["tender"],en-GB,"121_20 Sandwiches, Food-to-Go, Confectionery and Snacks","Supply of a range of sandwiches, food-to-go, confectionery and snack products.
Lot 1: Sandwiches and Food-to-Go - Supply of a range of sandwiches and food-to-go products, to include but not limited to salads, snack pots, sushi and other related products.
Lot 2: Confectionery and Snacks - Supply of a range of confectionery and snack items, to include but not limited to chocolate bars, sweets, biscuits, cake bars and crisps.
The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. The total estimated value stated includes the option period.
An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

176640153,cf_notices,09ddf1d7-527b-4981-b923-ceb5983b77d7,ocds-0c46vo-0001-09ddf1d7-527b-4981-b923-ceb5983b77d7,["tender"],en-GB,Robert Watson Garden Charitable Funds Project,"The Northampton General Hospital NHS Trust (NGH) is looking to identify a supplier for the Robert Watson Garden Charitable Funds Project. The appointed supplier will work closely with the Trust's Capital Projects Team and Northamptonshire Health Charity
DN464990 - The tender pack sets out the information which is required in order to assess the suitability of applicants to meet the Trust's requirements.

The successful applicant will be required to deliver services in accordance with all attached documents and the contract to be placed. The contract will be subject to Northampton General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust's requirements and satisfactory performance through continuous monitoring and performance review.  During the contract life, the successful applicants will need to achieve continuous improvement.  Failure to do so may result in the contract being terminated.

The entire tendering process must be carried out through the ProActis (Due North) ProContract system. The use of ProActis Due North will ensure the safe and efficient transfer of tender documentation sent on behalf of the client to the contractor and by the contractor back to the client.  Automatic access to the tender documentation will be granted on completion of registration to the ProActis Due North site.
To register and access the documents please use the following link:
https://procontract.due-north.com/SupplierRegistration/Requirements

We advise you to check that you have registered either a minimum of 2 addresses within your company, or else a group address (e.g. sales@...) which is regularly checked by more than one person.  This will help to ensure that you will receive any additional information that we publish and that you will be able to submit your Tender, even if a key person is absent.

To prevent your IT system from treating web based messages from Due North as junk or spam, please mark ProContract Notifications as a "safe" sender, and/or ensure that registered addressees check their "Junk" folder regularly to pick up any such messages before they are automatically deleted.
For technical help on using ProContract Due North, please contact the support team at procontractsuppliers@proactis.com  or call them on +44 (0)1670 597120

176417019,cf_notices,305f0d93-34fa-4f8c-8676-d2addabb6b87,ocds-0c46vo-0001-305f0d93-34fa-4f8c-8676-d2addabb6b87,["tender"],en-GB,Havant Thicket Reservoir Project,"Pursuant to Reg. 58 of the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016, Portsmouth Water Limited ("PW") is hosting a Supply Chain Engagement Event on 25.03.2020 to raise market awareness of the potential opportunities associated with its Havant Thicket Reservoir project ("Project") and to start its pre-procurement supply chain engagement exercise.  Please use the following link to register for the Supply Chain Engagement Event https://portsmouthwater.delta-esourcing.com/respond/8QJW68G5PR.

It is envisaged that the Project will be delivered through various packages of contracts, including both works and services contracts. The main scope of the Project includes the design and construction of:
(i)Main reservoir works;
(ii)Pipeline works;
(iii)MEICA works;
(iv)Pumping station upgrades;
(v)Pre-treatment facility;
(vi)Visitor centre;
(vii)Environmental mitigation works; and

Electronic Trading. Potential suppliers must note the mandatory requirement for electronic trading currently via email invoicing, with Babcock DSG Limited.

The Cyber risk level is low and the Risk Assessment Reference RAR code is RAR-9CDU6MD2. All Potential Operators who are invited to tender must complete the Supplier Assurance Questionnaire (SAQ) via the Supplier Cyber Protection Service (Octavian) https://supplier-cyber-protection.service.gov.uk/ to demonstrate their compliance with the required cyber risk level. This is a self-assurance process and no validation of the SAQ return is required.
Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk

Justification For Non-Competitive Decision: It is considered this requirement can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication pursuant to Article 25(1)(a) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(i) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011) due to the absence of suitable tenders in response to the previous restricted procedure reference 2019/S 146-360833. In respect of the previous restricted procedure, the UK Ministry of Defence received a single tender response and that tender was evaluated as being commercially non-compliant.

177553457,cf_notices,d8534ad5-fa90-46ed-a64f-a2bf0712620c,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d8534ad5-fa90-46ed-a64f-a2bf0712620c,["tender"],en-GB,The Development of Apprenticeship Standards in the NHS - Health Education England - PIN - NHS/SoEPS/20.640,"NHS South of England Procurement Services (SoEPS), acting on behalf of Health Education England (HEE - the Commissioner) are putting out this notice as a PIN (Prior Information Notice) with a view to completing a Direct Award.

Please note the contracting authority intends to direct award the contract to Skills for Health for a short period of time while it determines the authority's commissioning intentions. The case for direct award can be found on the tender portal.

HEE believe that Skills for Health is the only supplier who can support the above programme requirements for one year in 2020/21, with their technical expertise and experience (since 2016) in order to maintain  continuity (from 1 April 2020 until 31 March 2021) to fulfill HEE's mandate deliverables (developing new apprenticeship standards for clinical and non-clinical jobs in the NHS) and the actions  of the Long Term Plan and People Plan (such as offering important opportunities for widening social participation in the NHS workforce providing and career ladders for staff to develop their skills).
It is envisaged that while the current specifications are underway in 2020, an open procurement process will be undertaken for work to be started in April 2021 onwards (2-3 years).
The contract period of one year will be a maximum value of £550,000 exclusive of VAT.
For the Specification, Contract and the case for direct award please access the portal at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/soepscommissioning
Project title: The Development of Apprenticeship Standards in the NHS - Health Education England - NHS/SoEPS/20.640
Please access the portal for all documents.
Should providers have any problems using the portal, they should contact the In-tend dedicated Supplier Helpdesk by calling 0845 557 8079 Monday to Friday (9am to 5pm) or email support@in-tend.co.uk
All communications should be made via the messaging function on the In-tend E-Tendering portal.

If any provider has concerns with the commissioning intentions outlined within the published documentation, please raise this via the Intend eTendering Portal in the first instance within 30 days of the date of this Prior Information Notice.
The closing date of this PIN is midnight on the 23rd March 2020.

•To provide a safe and exciting environment for children with complex health needs to be away from their home for a specified period of time.
•To offer structured sessions and setting objectives and outcomes for each child.
•To support parents and carers in encouraging children to enjoy and achieve
•To provide 1:1 support to families of children and young people who have a disability, with complex needs

•To provide a good level of competent staff to support children and young people with a disability to access a programme of activities and develop their independent skills",0,GBP,2020-02-21 177322384,cf_notices,af0bdc6d-00c4-47c9-9ade-c8d1b007e3a8,ocds-0c46vo-0001-af0bdc6d-00c4-47c9-9ade-c8d1b007e3a8,["tender"],en-GB,CETE107 A624 Swallow House Lane Bridge Bearing Replacement,"Derbyshire County Council is seek to appoint a Principle Contractor for the A624 Swallow House Lane, Bridge Bearing Replacement.   The works comprise:-
Provide, design, construction, installation and maintain until the defects date all
necessary works, comprising the design and installation of Bearings at the
Abutments, Major Maintenance Works to Bearings at Piers and Bridge
Expansion Joints and Carriageway Resurfacing.

177322367,cf_notices,b705b560-4fd3-4d6a-8946-a052369a8e0a,ocds-0c46vo-0001-b705b560-4fd3-4d6a-8946-a052369a8e0a,["tender"],en-GB,Christmas Light Electricity Supply - Lymington High Street,"Lymington and Pennington Town Council invites tenders from suitably qualified electrical contractors to replace the current lighting connection for Christmas lights with an alternative long term, safe and discreet electrical solution. Lymington High Street currently has a cross street display of LED icicles and bulbs that currently takes it power from the top of 25 lighting columns throughout Queen St, St. Thomas Street and High Street which are evenly spaced throughout, thereby creating a flowing effect through the town & down the hill. The Town Council is keen to carry on with this cross street lighting display for 2020 and subsequent years. The advice given by SSE is that in order to install the same display and utilise the bulb and icicle lighting purchased by the Town Council, there is a need for feeder pillars to be installed at suitable locations on the High Street, taking an unmetered supply from the Low Voltage network. L&PTC is inviting suitable contractors to provide a detailed solution to power our Christmas lights display independent of the street lighting columns used in previous years. This solution may include the use of feeder pillars or a format you feel would work best for this town. Please see attached documents for more details",0,GBP,2020-02-20 11:17:24.000000,,2020-03-27 00:00:00.000000,Lymington & Pennington Town Council,"Town Hall, Lymington Avenue Road 177094168,cf_notices,abdd0a56-2751-4904-85ee-251a91df4ac9,ocds-0c46vo-0001-abdd0a56-2751-4904-85ee-251a91df4ac9,["tender"],en-GB,Hailsham Country Park Path Around Lake,"Resurfacing path around lake.
provision of timber edging to both sides of existing path. Excavate for edgings and supply and lay 100mm X 25mm timber edgings with timber pegs at 1m centres. Total length 512m X 2 = 1024m
Surfacing of existing path. regulate levels with type 1 sub base. Supply and lay avg. 30mm of 10mm surface course (AC10 close surf). Total area 512m X 2m = 1024m2.
Provide price for the edging and surfacing as described above to:
Hailsham Town Council, Inglenook, Market Street, Hailsham, East Sussex BN27 2AE by 5pm on 31st March 2020.
Work to commence in May 2020 and complete by the end of June 2020.
For site visit please contact the Council.

The initial contract term will commence on 01 September 2020, ending on 31 August 2023. The extension period, which will be awarded at the discretion of the CCG will commence on 01 September 2023 ending on 31 August 2025.NECS is managing the procurement process for and on behalf of NHS South Tyneside CCG.  NECS is utilising an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with potential providers.  Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to potential providers, and all communications and submissions will be conducted via the In-Tend Portal https://in-tendhost.co.uk/nhsnecsu/aspx/Home.Should bidders have any queries, or are having problems registering; they should contact the In-Tend helpdesk via:support@in-tend.com or on 0845 557 8079 / +44 (0) 114 407 0065The helpdesk is open Monday - 177094111,cf_notices,cf809dbd-3eae-47c2-aca5-7e93959513a6,ocds-0c46vo-0001-cf809dbd-3eae-47c2-aca5-7e93959513a6,["tender"],en-GB,Programme Internal Audit,"IPPF is a global service provider and a leader advocate of sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) for all. IPPF provides SRHR services in 172 countries and runs approximately 65,000 service points worldwide. IPPF is currently implementing The Women's Integrated Sexual Health (WISH2ACTION - W2A) programme.

WISH2ACTION - W2A programme is UK Government's flagship health programme designed to transform the lives of millions of women and girls. Funded by the UK's Department for International Development (DFID), WISH will provide integrated and holistic sexual and reproductive healthcare to millions of additional users across 27 countries in Africa and South Asia from 2018-2021.

IPPF is now inviting eligible individual consultants, to participate in the prequalification of a roster of internal audit consultants. The internal audit review of the project will initially be for the 10 IPPF MA countries  in WISH Lot 2.

IPPF provides SRHR services in 172 countries and runs approximately 65,000 service points worldwide. IPPF is currently implementing The Women's Integrated Sexual Health (WISH2ACTION - W2A) programme.
WISH2ACTION - W2A programme is UK Government's flagship health programme designed to transform the lives of millions of women and girls. Funded by the UK's Department for International Development (DFID), WISH will provide integrated and holistic sexual and reproductive healthcare to millions of additional users across 27 countries in Africa and South Asia from 2018-2021.
IPPF is now inviting eligible individual consultants, to participate in the prequalification of a roster of internal audit consultants. The internal audit review of the project will initially be for the 10 IPPF MA countries  in WISH Lot 2.

Lot 2 Zero Emission from the Contract Start Date 05 October 2020  - Hydrogen Vehicles

176640274,cf_notices,12533e6e-8339-42c3-b3f3-cc83a20c6a11,ocds-0c46vo-0001-12533e6e-8339-42c3-b3f3-cc83a20c6a11,["tender"],en-GB,"HAC5621 Integrated Information, Advice and Advocacy Services (IAA)","This procurement aim to secure a competent contractor for the delivery of an integrated Information, Advice and Advocacy (IAA) service for Tower Hamlets residents

The service will support the council to manage demand on its adult social care front door and health services by providing free, independent, quality-assured information, advice and advocacy across health, social care and social welfare in order to resolve issues and prevent or delay needs/problems escalating, and support residents to remain independent and healthy.

The service will be linked in with preventative services across the borough such as social prescribing, care and community navigators as well as hospitals and others. The IAA service will offer early help and support to residents and carers through: a digital portal, a telephone based triage/information/advice service and face-to-face outreach support. The budget available for this contract is up to £3,360,000.

172749007,cf_notices,570ce8a5-8fd5-403e-977c-3c865e90f5d7,ocds-0c46vo-0001-570ce8a5-8fd5-403e-977c-3c865e90f5d7,["tender"],en-GB,"Ref 143 - Glendarroch, Craigs Road, Dumfries, Scotland","Scope of Services

Progress Housing Group (PHG) are seeking an experienced Contractor to complete a refurbishment on one of their existing properties. This property is currently occupied by tenants with various learning difficulties. The property is no longer suitable to meet tenant's needs. PHG intend to source a compliant Contractor to take on the adaptation and refurbishment works to this existing domestic property. The Contractor will need to be fully compliant with all Health and Safety regulations and any other industry requirements. In summary, the works include the following;
•Modification and conversion of garage to form additional en-suite wet rooms, including adapting the roof structure.
•Internal alterations and refurbishment works within the existing property to form additional en-suite wet rooms.
•Associated plumbing and M&E services alterations.
•Associated decoration and new floor finishes throughout the property.

Due to this work being carried out the living tenants will be relocated into temporary accommodation, this will be at an additional cost to the organisation and it is therefore important that the programme is delivered on time and as per the specification programme.

The property is located in Glendarroch, Craigs Road, Dumfries, Scotland and will be covered by Scottish Building regulations and Scottish Building Contract. It is beneficial that all bidders have some knowledge and experience, however there is an Employers Agent on this project who will assist in this process.
Site Visits
Bidders are to arrange a site visit with the Employers Agent. Please refer to the procurement timetable for allocated date.
Contract term

The anticipated Contract is for a one off project, contract duration is 8 weeks starting at the end of March 2020 and completed by mid-May 2020.                                                                                                                                                                     Organisations must be registered and hold a verified status within all relevant Work Categories on Constructionline to at least Silver level.
Organisations must also be Safety Schemes in Procurement (SSIP) registered on application

166455562,cf_notices,ce5f131c-05db-44ea-8123-9875f27ab60f,ocds-0c46vo-0001-ce5f131c-05db-44ea-8123-9875f27ab60f,["tender"],en-GB,CETE084 Woodville to Swadlincote Regeneration Route,Derbyshire County Council (DCC) is to procure the Woodville to Swadlincote Regeneration Route. DCC is working in partnership with South Derbyshire Dales Council (SDDC) to provide the road and open up the land adjacent for development. The new road is a standard 7.3m wide all-purpose single carriageway designed to service commercial and residential developments thereof. A shared footway is to be provided along the northern side of the road and around each roundabout while a footway is to be installed on the south side. Sections of the footways have verge separation between the carriageway and footways and additional verges at the back of the footway. The route and its roundabouts will be landscaped to meet ecological and National Forest requirements. New highway drainage systems and attenuation ponds will be installed adjacent to the route and will be enhanced for similar ecological benefit. Surface water flows will be attenuated by Hydrobrakes. The Contractor will also be responsible for installing and maintaining the landscaping associated with the link road to complete the works. The route is aimed at facilitating development of the adjacent former open cast mine workings to provide commercial and residential units. Provision will be made within the highway corridor for new utilities and plot drainage crossings between adjacent parcels of development land.,8000000,GBP,2020-01-03 14:26:30.000000,2020-01-03 168017339,cf_notices,3151ae1d-c9a4-4d1f-ad82-4f8aff775a3a,ocds-0c46vo-0001-3151ae1d-c9a4-4d1f-ad82-4f8aff775a3a,["tender"],en-GB,Cleaning Maintenance Contracts For Banbury Town Council,"These are 2 contracts that can be priced individually or as a combined operation for the daily cleaning of toilets (including possibly mess rooms for staff labelled as provisional items) with the second contract for the cleaning of sports pavilions following football or cricket matches.  Interested companies must return tenders by Noon on 24th January 2020 in a plain envelope using the label provided.  Any identification of the company tendering or lack of the label on the return envelope will result in the tender not being considered.
The toilets as mentioned require daily cleaning Monday to Friday all year round but excluding Bank Holidays.

The Sports Pavilions require cleaning on a Saturday if games are played on a Saturday and Sunday.  However if games are only played on one day the cleaning can be undertaken on the next working day.  Some games may be also played mid-week, which will require cleaning on the following day.
Currently the cleaning of toilets is approximately 1 hour per day with the changing rooms taking approximately 13 hours per week.

It is unlikely that there are any TUPE implications from the current grounds maintenance contractor due to the work being contracted out to a sub-contractor or being undertaken by grounds maintenance operatives who will not be TUPE'd as cleaners.  Prior to this the work was undertaken by one operative only.

Although both contracts are for one year initially, if successful there is the opportunity for the contracts to be rolled forward for a further 4 years for the successful contractor.",0,GBP,2020-01-10
