168017326,cf_notices,9c2d757c-08be-4b86-a0ef-da450b5a0e41,ocds-0c46vo-0001-9c2d757c-08be-4b86-a0ef-da450b5a0e41,["tender"],en-GB,"Ref 143 - Glendarroch, Craigs Road, Dumfries, Scotland","Scope of Services

Progress Housing Group (PHG) are seeking an experienced Contractor to complete a refurbishment on one of their existing properties. This property is currently occupied by tenants with various learning difficulties. The property is no longer suitable to meet tenant's needs. PHG intend to source a compliant Contractor to take on the adaptation and refurbishment works to this existing domestic property. The Contractor will need to be fully compliant with all Health and Safety regulations and any other industry requirements. In summary, the works include the following;
•Modification and conversion of garage to form additional en-suite wet rooms, including adapting the roof structure.
•Internal alterations and refurbishment works within the existing property to form additional en-suite wet rooms.
•Associated plumbing and M&E services alterations.
•Associated decoration and new floor finishes throughout the property.

Due to this work being carried out the living tenants will be relocated into temporary accommodation, this will be at an additional cost to the organisation and it is therefore important that the programme is delivered on time and as per the specification programme.

The property is located in Glendarroch, Craigs Road, Dumfries, Scotland and will be covered by Scottish Building regulations and Scottish Building Contract. It is beneficial that all bidders have some knowledge and experience, however there is an Employers Agent on this project who will assist in this process.
Site Visits
Bidders are to arrange a site visit with the Employers Agent. Please refer to the procurement timetable for allocated date.
Contract term

The anticipated Contract is for a one off project, contract duration is 8 weeks starting at the end of March 2020 and completed by mid-May 2020.                                                                                                                                                                     Organisations must be registered and hold a verified status within all relevant Work Categories on Constructionline to at least Silver level.
Organisations must also be Safety Schemes in Procurement (SSIP) registered on application

169353674,cf_notices,f879f43a-3fcd-417d-bc8b-442a8aafa45a,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f879f43a-3fcd-417d-bc8b-442a8aafa45a,["tender"],en-GB,Hull Collaborative Academy Trust ICT Managed Service,The Hull Collaborative Academy Trust (HCAT) encompasses 15 Academies.   All of the Academies are Primary except The Marvell College which is a secondary setting for 11-16year olds.   The Trust has a mixed approach to its support for ICT.  The Marvell College was a new build Pfi school in 2013 and during this time has had a fully managed service from RM.  This contract comes to an end on the 31st August 2020.  Other Academies have a range of local providers and contract end dates.  The main purpose of this procurement is for the outsource of The Marvell College as a new 5year contract including goods and services.  As part of this procurement the Trust also wish to optionally include the Primary settings and any new academies they may take into the Trust during the contract period.   Only the Marvell College can be guaranteed by the winning bidder from the start of the contract.  Other sites will be added at the Trusts sole discretion.,2000000,GBP,2020-01-16 18:11:02.000000,,2020-02-17 00:00:00.000000,HULL COLLABORATIVE ACADEMY TRUST,The Marvell College Barham Road 167136891,cf_notices,e4485c11-f5ea-4ef4-88b7-030a626326ef,ocds-0c46vo-0001-e4485c11-f5ea-4ef4-88b7-030a626326ef,["tender"],en-GB,WHC - Decked Car Park :  Welwyn Garden City,"Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council is looking to appoint a Specialist Design and Build Contractor directly experienced in decked car parks as their partner to develop a new decked car park in central Welwyn Garden City.
The site is currently a public surface car park. The project is to increase capacity by:
Option A nett 180 car parking spaces or Option B nett 360 spaces depending on the completion and outcome of the Councils overall car parking study and strategy.

It is a requirement that tenderers submit bids for both options i.e. Option A and Option B. The evaluation criteria and scoring methodology will be the same for each option but the decision on which option to proceed with will be made separately by the Council outside of the tender evaluation process following completion of their overall Town Centre car parking strategy. The Council reserve the right to choose between Option A and Option B completely at their discretion and the highest scoring contractor in accordance with the evaluation methodology set out in Section 3 below for the selected Option shall be taken forward to the Second Stage irrespective of the tenderers position for the Option not to be proceeded with..

178250433,cf_notices,7c9aec39-33a2-45ce-bf8c-989dec5aaaee,ocds-0c46vo-0001-7c9aec39-33a2-45ce-bf8c-989dec5aaaee,["tender"],en-GB,GB-Dalby: Dalby VC Flat Roof Refurbishment,"Bidders are invited to tender for the complete refurbishment of the existing flat roof to the Dalby Visitors Centre, The work will include the following:
-Removing Stripping off the existing felt roof covering
-Inspecting and undertaking localised repairs to the timber deck, upstands, flashings, facias and parapets.

-Preparing roof joists and installing new tapered insulation laid to falls, vapour control layer and a proprietary built-up reinforced bitumen membrane system with a warranted service life of a minimum 20 years.
-Installing new rainwater pipes, soil & vent pipes, GRP trims, and a new 1200 x 1200mm triple skinned access hatch and domed roof light.
-Removing and refixing and commissioning the existing photovoltaic panels, solar water heating panels and pipes, satellite digital aerials and Man Safe restraint system
Forestry England requires an experienced and qualified contractor to propose a suitable solution for the replacement of the existing flat roof.

Works will include for all site preparation, welfare provision, and access to height equipment. Site safety within the fenced enclosure will be the Responsibility of the Contractor during the period of the works.",100000,GBP,2020-02-24 09:40:06.000000,,2020-03-10 00:00:00.000000,Forestry UK Biobank researchers have previously downloaded data for analysis within their own environment.  The increasing scale of the data requires a new approach to data storage and access that allows researchers to bring their analyses to the data through implementation of a managed informatics platform column1: 178250597,cf_notices,8c681164-c763-4106-ab80-cebb716d19d3,ocds-0c46vo-0001-8c681164-c763-4106-ab80-cebb716d19d3,["tender"],en-GB,GB-Oldham: Oldham Voids,"Housing 21 has a Private Finance Initiative (PFI) contract with Oldham Metropolitan Borough Council (OMBC) to deliver the provision of social housing services to OMBC stock of social housing and tenants.
Oldham PFI is a mix of sheltered schemes, bungalows and extra care. The stock consists of 613 flats in 19 sheltered schemes and 820 bungalows.

In order to deliver the PFI contract H21 engage sub-contractors to support the delivery of given services. Subcontractors should expect to engage with Housing 21 at a contractual and commercial level to meet the demands of Oldham Council and their tenants.

This SQ/ITT relates to the subcontracting of void properties on H21's PFI contract with OMBC. All the services will be delivered in and around the Oldham area only.",5000000,GBP,2020-02-24 11:40:07.000000,,2020-03-13 00:00:00.000000,Housing 21,Tricorn House 51-53 hagley Road,Birmingham,,B16 178250606,cf_notices,a5594d93-f571-43fe-881e-04374e2d5dd8,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a5594d93-f571-43fe-881e-04374e2d5dd8,["tender"],en-GB,CR20027 - Evaluation of the Arts and Humanities Research Council's Doctoral Training Partnership Scheme,"The final date and time for the submission of bids is Friday, 3rd April 2020 at 11:00
DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.
All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

The Doctoral Training Partnership (DTP) scheme is AHRC's main mechanism for supporting doctoral students.  It is a commitment of £164 million, over 11 awards, running from October 2014 to September 2022, by which time we will have supported more than 2,500 students.  It is important that AHRC reviews and evaluates the effectiveness of the scheme.  The supplier will undertake a robust, evidence-based review of the scheme which will enable AHRC to determine its future support for doctoral students.
The aim of the evaluation is to gain a better understanding of AHRC support for doctoral students through the DTP mechanism and whether the model itself is robust.
The main objective is to review the scheme against the original aims and principles for the scheme.
- Please make sure that you provide sufficient detail of you requirement so that potential suppliers will have a full understanding of what is required.
Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal.
This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the ITQ document.
How to Apply
UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement.
To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://uksbs.delta-esourcing.com and the follow the instructions to 'Login'
Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: F23ZF84S5Z

Please disregard any content in this notice that requests your organisation "to apply directly to the buyer" as this unfortunately a system generated error, that is outside of the Contracting Authorities control.

170282629,cf_notices,d45d656d-1eac-4e78-9041-e3110a194bda,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d45d656d-1eac-4e78-9041-e3110a194bda,["tender"],en-GB,Architectural Services for HRA New Build Works,"Newark and Sherwood District Council are currently developing a series of sites over the next 2-3 years.  We are looking to appoint an Architect to undertake site massing and feasibilities for the next phase of the HRA Build Programme plus additional one-off sites as required over a 12 month period then progress pre-contract services to obtain Planning consent and Principal Constructor information on a series of sites.  The post-contact service is not included within this Appointment.  We do, however require data to be produced for Principal Construction and we do anticipate the architect will be novated over to the construction frame work partner for the construction phase of the project.

This Appointment is to undertake the pre-contract services for a period of 12 months.  It is anticipated that this will be for circa 50-100 dwellings on a range of sites.  Some may only contain 1 or 2 units.  The sites are likely to be mostly 1 and 2 bed units of bungalow, house or apartment design of 1, 2 or 3 storeys.

180544328,cf_notices,8c568664-d858-4464-a765-2eff87c6448b,ocds-0c46vo-0001-8c568664-d858-4464-a765-2eff87c6448b,["tender"],en-GB,CPCA - Greater South East Energy Hub Regional Energy Mapping,"The Greater South East Energy Hub's requirements for Mapping Energy and Utilities Infrastructure for Regional Spatial Planning and is an invitation to submit a costed proposal for the supply of these products and services. The GSE Energy Hub wishes to appoint an organisation or consortium of organisations to develop and deliver: 1. A proof of concept mapping system that meets the requirements detailed in 4. 2. A report explaining the costed options for a final proposed mapping system. The proposal will be developed for a national approach and platform for regional energy mapping that all five Hubs could use, with potential to extend across the wider public sector stakeholders and meets the requirements detailed in 5. 3. Ongoing support meeting the requirements detailed in 4.4. The anticipated split in focus between the proof of concept mapping system, the report explaining the costed options for a final proposed mapping system (national approach) and ongoing support, is that the proof of concept mapping system is the majority of the work. Tender documents should identify in detail the expected breakdown between these three different aspects and provide appropriate justification in the tender document submitted for their allocation.",28000,GBP,2020-03-05 07:45:39.000000,,2020-04-03 00:00:00.000000,Cambridgeshire District Councils,Cambridge City Council Guildhall,Cambridge,,CB2 3QJ,United Kingdom,Chantel Allott,chantel.allott@cambridge.gov.uk,+44 1223458177,,,https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/8c568664-d858-4464-a765-2eff87c6448b,{71314000},2020-03-06 01:32:05.555487,2020-05-08 01:34:35.481986,"{""uri"": ""https://openopps.com/tenders/ocds-0c46vo-0001-8c568664-d858-4464-a765-2eff87c6448b/?format=json"", ""releases"": [{""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-8ad099d4-39a4-4101-86f1-16d68c37532f-347842-cambdc001-dn469035-00961233"", ""tag"": [""tender""], ""date"": ""2020-03-05T07:45:39Z"", ""ocid"": ""ocds-0c46vo-0001-8c568664-d858-4464-a765-2eff87c6448b"", ""buyer"": {""name"": ""Cambridgeshire District Councils"", ""address"": {""region"": null, ""locality"": ""Cambridge"", ""postalCode"": ""CB2 3QJ"", ""countryName"": ""United Kingdom"", ""streetAddress"": ""Cambridge City Council Guildhall""}, ""contactPoint"": {""name"": ""Chantel Allott"", ""email"": ""chantel.allott@cambridge.gov.uk"", ""faxNumber"": null, ""telephone"": ""+44 1223458177""}}, ""tender"": {""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-8ad099d4-39a4-4101-86f1-16d68c37532f-cambdc001-dn469035-00961233"", ""items"": [{""id"": 1, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""71314000"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-71314000.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Energy and related services""}}], ""title"": ""CPCA - 180544327,cf_notices,646520ff-a1d3-4707-a047-9e84b35efb28,ocds-0c46vo-0001-646520ff-a1d3-4707-a047-9e84b35efb28,["tender"],en-GB,Growth Service for Businesses in Cambridgeshire & Peterborough,"The contract is to appoint a single company or prime contractor/ consortia type arrangement to support the CPCA in delivering the Local Industrial Strategy by way of four specific areas of growth.
These include:
An Inclusive Growth Service,
to engage our highest potential growth firms to better support them to accelerate their growth, increase their capacity and capability for growth, sustain their period within growth, or all three.
An Inward Investment Service,

to extend our reach into key global markets, to engage and persuade overseas firms to locate into our economy or invest in our strategic projects to increase our employment space, develop our transport infrastructure or establish a new university.
A Skills Service,
to provide an effective brokerage between young talent and those retraining or progressing in a career, our employers and our skills providers, to improve the supply of skills to enable growth.
A Capital or Innovation & Re-Location Grant
to co-invest with small firms in the cost of contracting experts to help;
- to fund all businesses, especially traditional firms, to grow through organic expansion, paying for equipment and expanding premises
- to provide access to R&D funding from UK and EU agencies for new product growth and increased productivity
- to provide access to fast-track planning, partners and investment for new build employment space

These service will be delivered in each of our three sub-economies in a tailored manner to better spread growth more evenly across our total economy.",80000000,GBP,2020-03-05 180778692,cf_notices,991bd0f8-4332-4e33-9a42-91a15f9b664f,ocds-0c46vo-0001-991bd0f8-4332-4e33-9a42-91a15f9b664f,["tender"],en-GB,Blog and article writing and editing services for the Genomics Education Programme,"The Genomics Education Programme (GEP) was established in 2014 following an initial investment from the Department of Health to pump prime genomic education and training activity to support the delivery of the 100,000 Genomes Project. At the beginning of financial year 2018/19 the GEP became part of 'business as usual' within Health Education England (HEE) and, in collaboration with NHS England (NHSE), continues to support the newly launched NHS Genomic Medicine Service (GMS).

As part of its role in delivering education and training to the NHS workforce, the GEP requires specialist genomics editorial expertise to plan and produce a series of articles on genomics in healthcare that are useful and relevant to our audience groups, to be featured on our website's blog.

HEE is therefore inviting quotations from providers for the service commencing 1 April 2020 for 2 years, with the potential to extend.",0,GBP,2020-03-06 13:27:36.000000,,2020-03-17 180778821,cf_notices,513f67a8-8715-4b23-8428-e23d3fee9c8d,ocds-0c46vo-0001-513f67a8-8715-4b23-8428-e23d3fee9c8d,["tender"],en-GB,"The Provision of Building Cleaning Services at Wolverley CE Secondary School Blakeshall Lane, Wolverley, Kidderminster, Worcestershire DY11 5XQ","Place Partnership Ltd. on behalf of the Head Teacher and the Governing Body of Wolverley CE Secondary School Blakeshall Lane, Wolverley, Kidderminster, Worcestershire DY11 5XQ invite suitable, qualified and experienced Building Cleaning Contractors to submit a Competitive & Commercially Advantageous Tender submission to carry out the cleaning services of the school premises.

The contract is expected to start on 1st September 2019 and will run for a period of thirty-six (36) months with the possibility, following annual review of performance; the School may extend the Contract for further periods of up to twenty-four (24) months in increments of no more than twelve (12) months.
There are 13 existing cleaning staff who under TUPE regulations are eligible to transfer to the new contract.

The service includes: internal building cleaning, window cleaning including the provision of all associated materials, equipment and labour. To include in the fixed price all routine and non-routine cleaning.
A daily janitorial service is required during normal school hours.
The tender procedure is an OJUE Open process.
All operatives working on this site will be subject to an Enhanced Disclosure Baring Service Check (DBS) the costs associated with any checks will be borne by the contractor.
Site Visits are planned by appointment see tender documents for full details of available dates.
To arrange access to carry out this inspection contact the School Business Manager Anthony Derrer on   01562 859800  e-mail office@wolverley.worcs.sch.uk
It is on this basis that we invite suitable contractors to provide a full turn-key project compliant tender submission.
All tender documents must be uploaded to the portal by the due date as late returns will not be accepted.
Tenders and supporting documents shall be in English and any contract subsequently entered in to shall be subject to English Law.
Please note that the Supplier is responsible for obtaining all information necessary for the preparation of the tender submission.
All cost, expenses and liabilities incurred by the Supplier in connection with the preparation of their submission, the Form of Tender and Pricing Schedule shall be borne by the Supplier.
Tenders must remain open for acceptance, unless previously withdrawn for a minimum of 90 days from the date for the return of the Tender.
The contract will between the Head Teacher and the Governing Body of Wolverley CE Secondary School and the successful supplier.
Contract start date: Monday 3rd August 2020
Contract Mobilisation Period Starts: Monday 20th July 2020
The Head Teacher and the Governing Body of Wolverley CE Secondary School reserve the right not to award a contract in full or in part.

180778814,cf_notices,892b3811-ee97-4bcc-9a74-d7ff718a157b,ocds-0c46vo-0001-892b3811-ee97-4bcc-9a74-d7ff718a157b,["tender"],en-GB,"Strategy Development, Stakeholder Mapping and Consultation","LSBU has been collaborating with local authorities, HE, FE private and 3rd sector for many years on
the delivery of above programmes with beneficial impacts for the economy and society, however
we believe we could be better at understanding, enhancing and promoting the full range of what
we do and why it matters. Therefore, we are seeking a consultant to help us build on this existing
portfolio of work and support LSBU Group to:
- establish SBI as a key strategic partnership able to influence the design and delivery of the UK
Shared Prosperity Fund3
- support the development of a 'USP' and policy position for SBI with regard to the objectives,
priorities and architecture of the UKSPF and other related funding streams. This should be based
on the evidence of successful delivery of ESF and ERDF projects by LSBU Group and its partners
between 2014-2023.
- develop a funding strategy and action plan to ensure LSBU has a key role in the design and

delivery of UK Shared Prosperity Fund as it is rolled out in late 2021.",0,GBP,2020-03-06 14:41:19.000000,,2020-03-30 00:00:00.000000,London South Bank University,103 Borough Road ,London,,SE1 180778806,cf_notices,c789a29c-72e5-4fc1-905f-3e4547632669,ocds-0c46vo-0001-c789a29c-72e5-4fc1-905f-3e4547632669,["tender"],en-GB,Expressions of Interest for a tender list - The Kedleston Unit - General plant replacement associated with HCWS,"The Trust is looking for Expressions of Interest for  tendering for Building services works on our Kingsway Hospital site.

The Trust's Kingsway Site comprises of five individual mental health units together with corporate and Estates buildings. The Kedleston Low Secure Unit provides a gender specific low secure service for males who demonstrate disturbed behaviour in the context of a serious mental disorder and who require the provision of security. The plant replacement will be carried out within an externally accessed plant room of the Kedleston Unit, but contractors should be aware that the Kingsway Site grounds are continually available for our patients to use.

The works comprise the replacement of cold water storage tanks (3No.), water booster pumps (2No.) and chlorine dioxide dosing system including modifications to the existing heating installation in the plant room, modifications to domestic hot and cold water services, modifications to natural gas pipework and remedial works to comply with current water regulations.
The existing cold water storage tanks and booster pumps shall be replaced with a packaged 'pump and tank system' installed in the ground floor plantroom.
A new chlorine dioxide dosing system shall be installed within the ground floor plantroom, to dose the new packaged 'pump and tank system'

The works shall include the repositioning of the existing boilers including flues and low loss header arrangement, to create a space to accommodate the new chlorine dioxide dosing system mounted on the adjacent wall.
The works shall also include modifications to existing pipework within the roof void to facilitate removal of 3No. existing GRP cold water storage tanks.
The existing BMS system shall be extended to monitor the new packaged 'pump and tank system' and chlorine dioxide dosing system.
The works shall include all associated power and control wiring.

The Kedleston Unit - General plant replacement associated with HCWS"", ""value"": {""amount"": 0, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""status"": ""unsuccessful"", ""minValue"": {""amount"": 60000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""documents"": [{""id"": ""tender_url"", ""url"": ""https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/c789a29c-72e5-4fc1-905f-3e4547632669"", ""format"": ""text/html"", ""language"": ""en"", ""documentType"": ""tenderNotice""}], ""milestones"": [{""id"": 1, ""title"": ""Contract start"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-04-20T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract start date""}, {""id"": 2, ""title"": ""Contract end"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-05-29T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""The Trust is looking for Expressions of Interest for  tendering for Building services works on our Kingsway Hospital site. 
The Trust's Kingsway Site comprises of five individual mental health units together with corporate and Estates buildings. The Kedleston Low Secure Unit provides a gender specific low secure service for males who demonstrate disturbed behaviour in the context of a serious mental disorder and who require the provision of security. The plant replacement will be carried out within an externally accessed plant room of the Kedleston Unit, but contractors should be aware that the Kingsway Site grounds are continually available for our patients to use.
The works comprise the replacement of cold water storage tanks (3No.), water booster pumps (2No.) and chlorine dioxide dosing system including modifications to the existing heating installation in the plant room, modifications to domestic hot and cold water services, modifications to natural gas pipework and remedial works to comply with current water regulations.
The existing cold water storage tanks and booster pumps shall be replaced with a packaged 'pump and tank system' installed in the ground floor plantroom.
A new chlorine dioxide dosing system shall be installed within the ground floor plantroom, to dose the new packaged 'pump and tank system'
The works shall include the repositioning of the existing boilers including flues and low loss header arrangement, to create a space to accommodate the new chlorine dioxide dosing system mounted on the adjacent wall.
The works shall also include modifications to existing pipework within the roof void to facilitate removal of 3No. existing GRP cold water storage tanks.
The existing BMS system shall be extended to monitor the new packaged 'pump and tank system' and chlorine dioxide dosing system.
The works shall include all associated power and control wiring.
Design of the works will be carried out by Preston Lee Chambers, Building Services Consulting Engineers who will oversee the installation."", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2020-03-13T00:00:00Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": true, ""isSuitableForVco"": false, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Works""}, ""procurementMethod"": ""direct"", ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Single tender action (non-OJEU)"", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T02:11:20.036665+00:00""}",2020-03-06 14:40:06.000000

169846933,cf_notices,78b1ecbb-f49a-4aeb-904f-800c3cf3b7c1,ocds-0c46vo-0001-78b1ecbb-f49a-4aeb-904f-800c3cf3b7c1,["tender"],en-GB,Framework Agreement for Temporary Employment Agency/Agencies to supply Temporary Staff to stated work groups,"Thanet District Council is seeking to select and appoint to a Framework Agreement one or more (maximum of
4) suitably qualified Employment Agencies for the provision of temporary staff to the council for roles specified
(mainly commercial drivers and manual workers) who have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom. Full
detail of work groups/job titles required are contained in the Invitation to Tender Documentation.
Temporary workers may be required to work over the whole of the district or be based at one of one of the
council's operational sites, Manston Road Depot, Dane Park Depot, Ramsgate Port, Ramsgate Royal Harbour,
Broadstairs Harbour, or the main council offices in Margate.
The Framework Agreement is scheduled to commence 20th April 2020 and will be for a 3 year period with a
single option to extend by a further 12 months (at the sole discretion of the Council).
Evaluation will be as per the criteria and methodology as set out in the Invitation to Tender
Documentation, as will Call Off procedures which will include Direct Award in ranked order of agencies
appointed to the framework for specified work groups 1 & 2 and by means of mini competition of all appointed
agencies for work groups 3 - 6.
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: All procurement documents are available for download from the Kent Business
Portal at www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk and available for suppliers to download and complete according to
instructions contained.
Any clarifications or questions must be submitted via the message function of Kent Business Portal by no later
than 1400hrs Monday 10th February 2020.

Completed tender documents must be submitted electronically via the Kent Business Portal by no later than Monday 17th February 2020.",0,GBP,2020-01-18 15:25:42.000000,,2020-02-17 170950374,cf_notices,a11cbf83-d0a8-4522-af9b-6d7ab1876b22,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a11cbf83-d0a8-4522-af9b-6d7ab1876b22,["tender"],en-GB,CWC19140 Vaughan Road Subway Closure,"The existing poor condition of the Vaughan Road Subway and its current role as focus of antisocial behaviour in the area, has led the Wolverhampton City Council to develop a infilling solution. The project aims to completely infill the subway and accesses levelling the approaches up to the existing footway in order to develop a more aesthetically pleasant and safer area for pedestrians and local residents.
The following works are included in the scheme:
Decommission of the services affected by the works
Removal of existing subway elements, such as handrails, guardrails, parapets and bollards.
Infilling of existing subway with concrete.
Infilling existing access with class 1A granular material

Surface the infilled approach areas as directed by the City of Wolverhampton.",130000,GBP,2020-01-23 14:33:59.000000,,2020-02-13 00:00:00.000000,Wolverhampton City Council,Civic Centre St Peters Square,Wolverhampton,,WV1 1RL,England,James 170282628,cf_notices,c245146e-ee7b-4e15-b1b9-571ea2846485,ocds-0c46vo-0001-c245146e-ee7b-4e15-b1b9-571ea2846485,["tender"],en-GB,Provision of Tableau Consultancy to provide a suite of Highways dashboards,"Leicestershire County Council (LCC) has a centralised Business Intelligence Team (BI), based in the Chief Executive's Department, that provides performance and insight reporting across all LCC Departments using Tableau Server. Tableau Server currently has on average over 1000+ unique users a month and approximately 35,000 views.

After substantial work in our Children's and Adults Departments, development of Tableau reporting is now required in our Environment and Transport Department, specifically in the Highways Control Service who are responsible for maintenance of the highways network throughout Leicestershire.

The BI Development Team, a small team of Tableau and Business Intelligence Developers, requires support in building a series of new operational Tableau dashboards using data from our Highways SQL Server database (Confirm) to a varied user base with different requirements.

The supplier is required to work closely with our internal BI team and with the Highways Department. This will include detailed requirements gathering, co-design of dashboards and presenting back findings.  It will require a significant number of days spent on our premises, therefor this opportunity is not suitable to be conducted remotely.

Please note: Leicestershire County Council already has an existing contract for Tableau, the scope of this opportunity is to provide consultancy to provide a suite of Highways dashboards with our established software. Therefore, we are unable to accommodate bids based on the use of other software solutions.

Please Note: Our tendering portal will be unavailable all day on Saturday January 25th, 2020 this has been accounted for in the procurement timeline. If you intend to submit a bid we recommend you download all documents from the portal, in order to ensure you are not hampered by this scheduled downtime.

,60000,GBP,2020-01-20 09:35:00.000000,2020-01-20 00:00:00.000000,2020-02-03 00:00:00.000000,Leicestershire County Council,County Hall Leicester Road Glenfield,Leicester,,LE3 8RA,England,Caroline [{""id"": 1, ""title"": ""Contract start"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-08-01T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract start date""}, {""id"": 2, ""title"": ""Contract end"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-11-29T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""Leicestershire County Council (LCC) has a centralised Business Intelligence Team (BI), based in the Chief Executive's Department, that provides performance and insight reporting across all LCC Departments using Tableau Server. Tableau Server currently has on average over 1000+ unique users a month and approximately 35,000 views.

After substantial work in our Children's and Adults Departments, development of Tableau reporting is now required in our Environment and Transport Department, specifically in the Highways Control Service who are responsible for maintenance of the highways network throughout Leicestershire.

The BI Development Team, a small team of Tableau and Business Intelligence Developers, requires support in building a series of new operational Tableau dashboards using data from our Highways SQL Server database (Confirm) to a varied user base with different requirements.

The supplier is required to work closely with our internal BI team and with the Highways Department. This will include detailed requirements gathering, co-design of dashboards and presenting back findings.  It will require a significant number of days spent on our premises, therefor this opportunity is not suitable to be conducted remotely.

Please note: Leicestershire County Council already has an existing contract for Tableau, the scope of this opportunity is to provide consultancy to provide a suite of Highways dashboards with our established software. Therefore, we are unable to accommodate bids based on the use of other software solutions.

Please Note: Our tendering portal will be unavailable all day on Saturday January 25th, 2020 this has been accounted for in the procurement timeline. If you intend to submit a bid we recommend you download all documents from the portal, in order to ensure you are not hampered by this scheduled downtime.

180779021,cf_notices,bcab3c52-38fc-4dbb-a3fc-da58aa267699,ocds-0c46vo-0001-bcab3c52-38fc-4dbb-a3fc-da58aa267699,["tender"],en-GB,Welfare Rights & Housing Advice Services 2020 - 2023,"Canterbury City Council wants to commission information and advice services with a particular focus on welfare rights and housing advice.
Based on strong evidence of continuing local need, the provider will need to offer a range of welfare rights and housing advice services for local people.

The council wants to encourage early intervention and targeting of services to meet those in most need. This will help to ensure effective coordination and information sharing on service capacity and delivery issues to avoid duplication and ensure effective referrals.

The provider/s will ensure that the services offered fully align with and complement the district wide services offered by Canterbury City Council, in particular through the Housing and Community Services Teams.

The service delivered will be required to demonstrate high levels of social value through contributing to building resilience and self reliance of individuals to manage their own lives and the challenges they are faced with. The contract will focus  on preventative work with local residents focusing on appropriate advice enabling them to find the right preventative solutions to their circumstances. Full details and requirements are included within the Invitation to Quote documentation.

Important Notice: Suppliers should in the first instance register themselves on the Kent Business Portal by following registration instructions.  After registering suppliers are asked to express their interest in this opportunity, after which suppliers will be able to access and download all the required documents attached to this notice. Please ensure you download all documents and complete according to instructions contained.

180779039,cf_notices,113460ad-5fa9-4a43-a68a-1368af7f07a2,ocds-0c46vo-0001-113460ad-5fa9-4a43-a68a-1368af7f07a2,["tender"],en-GB,"Re-Tender - Spa Equipment - Planned Maintenance, Minor Installations and Responsive Repair Works for Operational, Schools and Commercial Buildings","North Tyneside Council (the 'Authority') is seeking tenders for the delivery of planned and responsive repairs and maintenance for operational, schools and commercial buildings. The Framework is for an initial period of 2 years with an option to extend for a further year (potential three year contract).
The works will be carried out anywhere within the Borough of North Tyneside and include planned and reactive services to repair and maintain spa, sauna and jacuzzis inc auxiliary equipment.
The Contractor(s) will work with the Authority to provide innovative solutions to reduce costs and streamline delivery/collection methods throughout the contract term.
Tenderers will be ranked with up to 3 contractors being awarded a place on the framework.

Responsive repair services will be provided by the first ranked Contractor using their submitted rates, if the first ranked Contractor cannot fulfil the requirements then the Authority shall contact the second ranked and then the third ranked where applicable. Following establishment of the responsive repairs framework the Authority shall carry out mini-competitions for the planned preventative maintenance element of the contract.",150000,GBP,2020-03-06 16:52:16.000000,,2020-04-03 00:00:00.000000,North Tyneside Council,"Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North",North Tyneside,,NE27 0BY,England,Christine Bordoli,christine.bordoli@northtyneside.gov.uk,+44 1916435662,,,https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/113460ad-5fa9-4a43-a68a-1368af7f07a2,{45000000},2020-03-07 01:32:23.590742,2020-05-08 02:11:39.701525,"{""uri"": ""https://openopps.com/tenders/ocds-0c46vo-0001-113460ad-5fa9-4a43-a68a-1368af7f07a2/?format=json"", ""releases"": [{""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-202f44b2-a7b8-436d-96b9-aff2d4526ad3-348410-ntyn001-dn469641-59003208"", ""tag"": [""tender""], ""date"": ""2020-03-06T16:52:16Z"", ""ocid"": ""ocds-0c46vo-0001-113460ad-5fa9-4a43-a68a-1368af7f07a2"", ""buyer"": {""name"": ""North Tyneside Council"", ""address"": {""region"": null, ""locality"": ""North Tyneside"", ""postalCode"": ""NE27 0BY"", ""countryName"": ""England"", ""streetAddress"": ""Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North""}, ""contactPoint"": {""uri"": ""http://www.northtyneside.gov.uk/"", ""name"": ""Christine Bordoli"", ""email"": ""christine.bordoli@northtyneside.gov.uk"", ""faxNumber"": null, ""telephone"": ""+44 1916435662""}}, ""tender"": {""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-202f44b2-a7b8-436d-96b9-aff2d4526ad3-ntyn001-dn469641-59003208"", ""items"": [{""id"": 1, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""45000000"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-45000000.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Construction work""}}, {""id"": 2, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""45215110"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-45215110.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Spa construction work""}}], ""title"": ""Re-Tender - 180544310,cf_notices,f5119c94-5f57-4f10-ba0a-9b2869968aeb,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f5119c94-5f57-4f10-ba0a-9b2869968aeb,["tender"],en-GB,Treatment to adult patients who have 5Q Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA) with the Drug Nusinersen (2),"NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands CSU (AGCSU) on behalf of NHS England Specialised Commissioning is inviting suitably qualified and experienced providers to deliver Treatment to adult patients who have 5Q Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA) with the Drug Nusinersen under the Compliance Process specified in Document 1 - Process Overview of process documentation.

On 24 July 2019, NICE published Technology appraisal guidance on the use of the drug Nusinersen to treat patients with 5q Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA). This is a rare, genetic, neuromuscular disease, characterised by spinal motor neuron loss, muscle atrophy and motor impairment. SMA is debilitating for all patients and fatal for the worst affected; patients and their families can experience extremely high levels of burden.

NHS England has agreed a 'Managed Access Agreement (MAA)' for the drug nusinersen for the treatment of eligible patients with spinal muscular atrophy (SMA). The NICE guidance sets out that the drug should only be made available to people who meet the criteria for treatment under the associated MAA.

The key objectives of the Compliance Process are: to commission the service(s) to serve adult patients eligible to receive the treatment nationally. It is estimated that 600 patients (adults and children) will be treated in England over the lifetime of the contract. Patients' eligibility and population covered are described in section 4 of the Managed Access Agreement. This may include treating patients from the devolved nations.

The Commissioner is seeking to appoint providers who have expertise in the treatment of adults with SMA (from 16-18 years of age, depending on local agreements) and who have the infrastructure both to be able to treat patients with nusinersen (which is given by intrathecal injection) and to collect detailed monitoring information about eligible patients. Providers will need to demonstrate that they are suitably qualified and can meet the agreed service requirements.

In 2019, NHS England ran a compliance process to appoint providers to deliver the service and was able to appoint several suitably qualified and experienced providers. Since then, the Commissioners have assessed patients' needs and have identified service gaps nationally. In order to address these gaps, the Commissioners are re-issuing the opportunity.

Further information about scope and qualification requirements can be found in the process documentation published on the EU Supply eTender/Procurement portal (Quote/tender 39295). All communications regarding this opportunity will be managed via the EU Supply messaging service.",1,GBP,2020-03-05 17:32:27.000000,,2020-04-01 00:00:00.000000,NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands 180544157,cf_notices,e9ae13b6-ca1a-41c2-a550-b33f644f9b34,ocds-0c46vo-0001-e9ae13b6-ca1a-41c2-a550-b33f644f9b34,["tender"],en-GB,"Refurbishment of Ground Floor and Fourth Floor at Beech House, Poole","Refurbishment of Ground Floor and Fourth Floor at Poole Housing Partnership (PHP), Beech House, 28-30 Wimborne Road, Poole, BH15 2BU.
The contract requires works to two separate areas, which are to be phased, within the Ground Floor and Fourth Floor Offices. Provision is to be made for out of hours and weekend working.

The Council will make the areas available for the contractor for a maximum period of eight weeks to carry out the specified works. Works to the fourth floor are to be completed no later than the 31 August 2020.

Normal service to all areas will continue for the duration of the works. Provision is to be made for a temporary reception facility and safe areas for staff and members of the public to access and wait.
All works are to be compliant with Building Regulations and all reference to DDA are to be compliant with Part M volume 2 of the Building Regulations.

180311672,cf_notices,0cba2650-6363-47b4-affc-9e530b42a456,ocds-0c46vo-0001-0cba2650-6363-47b4-affc-9e530b42a456,["tender"],en-GB,Mechanical Maintenance Dredging,"Thanet District Council is seeking the supply of a mechanical (as opposed to hydrodynamic) dredging contractor to undertake maintenance dredging within the Harbour Limits of the Port of Ramsgate, including the Royal Harbour.

Thanet District Council shall not guarantee any minimum quantity of work or number of dredging campaigns as a result of entering into this contract, as the volumes for each campaign will be derived through examination of Hydrographical Bathymetry Surveys for the Port of Ramsgate, to maintain depths of water for safe navigation.
The procurement process will be undertaken on the basis of an open tender.  Evaluation will be on the basis of quality and costs, as set out in the Invitation to Tender document.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION: Suppliers should in first instance register themselves on the Kent Business Portal by following registration instructions www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk. All procurement documents are available on the KBP site attached to the published contract notice and available for suppliers to download and complete according to instructions contained.
Any clarifications or questions must be submitted via the discussions area of the Kent Business Portal by no later than 14.00 hrs on 26 March 2020.
Completed tender documents must be submitted electronically via the Kent Business Portal by no later than 14.00 hrs on 1 April 2020.

180311628,cf_notices,abcbb432-eb75-4c74-a7e7-3d8f5e20355e,ocds-0c46vo-0001-abcbb432-eb75-4c74-a7e7-3d8f5e20355e,["tender"],en-GB,"Archaeological Assessment and Evaluation, Copenhagen Street car park, Worcester","Worcester City Council is inviting Tenders from Potential Contractors for provision of an archaeological desk-based assessment and evaluation of Copenhagen Street car park, Worcester.

The Project is to comprise a detailed archaeological desk-based assessment, including creation of a deposit model, and preservation assessment, and archaeological field evaluation by borehole and limited trenching. The results of the fieldwork will feed back into the deposit model and preservation assessment.
The Council are using the e-procurement portal known as the Due North Pro-Contract portal https://procontract.due-north.com to conduct this procurement exercise.

To gain access to the procurement documents, contractors will need to register their company details at the above website. Once registered, contractors will be emailed a log-in and password which will allow them to gain access to the procurement documents. Contractors will need to search for the invitation under Worcester City Council and then electronically submit an expression of interest and follow the online instructions to view the procurement 180311480,cf_notices,061bd3e9-333f-4b86-a466-9c0c3537343c,ocds-0c46vo-0001-061bd3e9-333f-4b86-a466-9c0c3537343c,["tender"],en-GB,Framework for the Supply & Delivery of a Benchtop laboratory granulator (batch),"CPI have a requirement for a flexible, small-batch granulation device that has control of mixing energy/RPM, consistent liquid/binder addition, and a range of different mixer geometries.

CPI have extensive capability in terms of continuous granulation and powder processing but have identified a gap in terms of the ability to produce batch quantities of granulated materials with very small amounts of materials, insufficient for running within a continuous process. We often must undertake granulation projects where the amount of materials available to produce an optimised granule is highly limited, hence the capability to produce small batches of granules for analysis and study is seen as highly complementary to existing capability.",100000,GBP,2020-03-04 09:18:46.000000,,2020-03-18 00:00:00.000000,CENTRE FOR PROCESS INNOVATION LIMITED,Wilton We often must undertake granulation projects where the amount of materials available to produce an optimised granule is highly limited, hence the capability to produce small batches of granules for analysis and study is seen as highly complementary to existing capability."", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2020-03-18T00:00:00Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": true, ""isSuitableForVco"": false, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Products""}, ""procurementMethod"": ""open"", ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Open (non-OJEU)"", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T02:11:14.101511+00:00""}",2020-03-04 09:18:46.000000

180311477,cf_notices,87d17a60-aadb-454a-aaf7-1cafd3df48b0,ocds-0c46vo-0001-87d17a60-aadb-454a-aaf7-1cafd3df48b0,["tender"],en-GB,Adult Social Care and Health Policies and Practice Guides Project,"Reading Borough Council is looking to work with a suitable provider to refresh (and in some cases write) the Council's Directorate of Adult Social Care & Health (DASCH) policies and staff practice guides. The aim is to ensure that they are clear, informative and accessible whilst setting clear expectations of working practices for adult social care staff at all levels from senior managers to operational and business support staff.

The Council wishes to gain the potential interest of experienced providers to deliver a refreshed suite of policies and staff practice guides for Adult Social Care & Health staff. The scope of the work is to review and develop the following:
o Policies
Overarching policies (documents that provide staff with the framework to meet statutory and legal requirements. E.g. Safeguarding, Finance and Moving & Handling) and
o Practice Guides

Practice guidelines (guidance that is sometimes called protocols / guides / frameworks / templates / forms or checklists). They cover work undertaken by certain staff or teams. Often it is the 'translation' of a policy or procedure into local language and within local workflows.

180079701,cf_notices,d54f8cbe-8b9e-451b-be75-fcfc5b5bd9ce,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d54f8cbe-8b9e-451b-be75-fcfc5b5bd9ce,["tender"],en-GB,Provision and Maintenance of Intruder Alarms,"The Isle of Wight Council invites Tenders from suitably qualified suppliers for the provision of Support, Servicing, Installations of the Council Building Intruder Alarms.

The contract will include and cover all Council buildings in scope which use and operate an intruder alarm. Included in the contract is at least one annual maintenance inspection where minimum criteria (set out in the tender documents) need to be checked. The contractor should be able respond to fix and issues as they are noticed with the intruder alarm system either by the contractor or by the Authority.

Call out arrangements for site which might include key holding responsibilities will form part of the contract with links through to the Police service as appropriate. The contractor should have access to or manage an alarm receiving centre (ARC) to receive any alarm instances for response to.

180079697,cf_notices,10a7c6e0-df01-4ad3-9bb9-0b630532f02c,ocds-0c46vo-0001-10a7c6e0-df01-4ad3-9bb9-0b630532f02c,["tender"],en-GB,Event Stewarding and Crowd Control Services,"Charnwood Borough Council are seeking tenders for the provision of Event Stewarding and Crowd control services.

The Council operates several key Town Centre events each year, one being the Loughborough Fair, one of the largest charter street fairs in the country which attracts an average of 30000 - 40000 visitors over the 4 day period. During these events health & safety of members of the public and staff members is critical to the success and safe delivery of each event.

The aim of this tender is to secure a highly professional stewarding and event control management company with extensive experience of non-ticketed public events who will provide a high standard of Event Stewarding & Crowd Control Services to the council throughout this contract.

The last date for request of documents is the 20th March 2020, with Tenders to be returned by 12 Noon on the 3rd April 2020.",100000,GBP,2020-03-03 09:18:14.000000,,2020-04-03 180079653,cf_notices,7bc83aa1-02fe-42ea-8936-0b7b3cec0661,ocds-0c46vo-0001-7bc83aa1-02fe-42ea-8936-0b7b3cec0661,["tender"],en-GB,Homecare Service in Lincolnshire,"Lincolnshire County Council is undertaking a procurement exercise for its regulated Homecare, in line with Regulations 74-76 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (PCR), the Light Touch Regime, and pursuant to 2 / 8 Regulation 76(7) of the PCR. The Homecare services will meet the health and social care needs for adults aged 18 and over who are ordinarily resident in Lincolnshire. Care will be provided in the home (including Extra Care facilities) covering a range of care/support services to enable individuals to maximise their independence for as long as possible and maintain their safety. The contract will be divided into lots with a single, lead provider awarded in each of the twelve (12) areas. The main purpose of the contract will be to provide regulated domiciliary care services to individuals eligible for Social Care under the County Council. In the life of the contract it may also be necessary to purchase additional volume on behalf of local Heath bodies (CCGs) and if so this will be on the same terms as the Council service. A bidders event will be held on the afternoon of the 19th March 2020 in Lincoln, for those interested in attending please contact catherine.lees@lincolnshire.gov.uk",360000000,GBP,2020-03-03 Care will be provided in the home (including Extra Care facilities) covering a range of care/support services to enable individuals to maximise their independence for as long as possible and maintain their safety. The contract will be divided into lots with a single, lead provider awarded in each of the twelve (12) areas. The main purpose of the contract will be to provide regulated domiciliary care services to individuals eligible for Social Care under the County Council. In the life of the contract it may also be necessary to purchase additional volume on behalf of local Heath bodies (CCGs) and if so this will be on the same terms as the Council service. A bidders event will be held on the afternoon of the 19th March 2020 in Lincoln, for those interested in attending please contact catherine.lees@lincolnshire.gov.uk"", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2020-05-11T00:00:00Z"", ""startDate"": ""2020-03-03T12:53:23Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": false, ""isSuitableForVco"": false, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Services""}, ""procurementMethod"": null, ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Other - "", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T02:11:14.862200+00:00""}",2020-03-03 12:53:23.000000

179850923,cf_notices,f998ed6f-5c04-41a5-8af5-fc373f2db653,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f998ed6f-5c04-41a5-8af5-fc373f2db653,["tender"],en-GB,Executive Producer Creative XR,"Digital Catapult is looking for a partner to provide Executive Producer services for the CreativeXR programme.
The Executive Producer role is to shape, support and add value to the CreativeXR Cohort 3 programme of workshops, mentorships and ongoing programme strategy.

Specifically, the Executive Producer will provide programme strategy recommendations, industry insight, analysis and introductions, act as a programme evangelist, judging services and expertise as part of cohort selection, business development workshops to the cohort, mentor cohort companies both from a business standpoint and creatively, and ongoing liaising and reporting to the Digital Catapult CreativeXR team.

Digital Catapult are looking to award the position of CreativeXR Executive Producer to a supplier who has current extensive experience in curating and organising international immersive showcase and market events.
The Executive Producer must also sit on content advisory boards in the UK and have an extensive knowledge of CR&D funding and familiarity with other grant funded initiatives in the UK.
The Executive Producer must be an experienced immersive judge and panellist with an international profile and have experience dealing with senior stakeholders in the public and private sector.
CreativeXR is an acceleration programme designed for UK teams from the creative and technology sector who have strong, well-developed, ground-breaking creative ideas that need early-stage financing.
Now in its third year, CreativeXR is run as a partnership between Digital Catapult and Arts Council England
You can find more about the programme on

179172424,cf_notices,41005f44-8a8c-44c9-8ac0-fa9d857a7044,ocds-0c46vo-0001-41005f44-8a8c-44c9-8ac0-fa9d857a7044,["tender"],en-GB,Temporary Exhibition AV Projection,"NAM is staging a temporary exhibition that explores the role of the British Army in Germany post 1945. The exhibition opens to the public on 8th May but is required to be completed by 4th May 2020 to allow for press, PR and a private view to take place. The exhibition runs for 1 year.
As part of the exhibition build the main build contractors are creating a profile of a Chieftain tank in MDF, CNC routed as per drawings A22, A23.
NAM would like to appoint a creative audio-visual company to create and deliver a sequence of film and animation that will be projected onto the tank.
•
column2: Excerpts from the Lionheart 84 film from the IWM which shows the biggest mobilisation of troops to test and demonstrate the ability of NATO forces to withstand an attack from Russia.

column1: •
column2: Film of Chieftain manoeuvres from the Allied Museum.

column1: •
column2: Production and Projection of the statistics outlined in Appendix E.

column1: All the above should be merged into a seamless film projection that will be motion triggered when visitors walk in the proximity of the tank profile.

When the film is not triggered, we would like to create a rendering of the Chieftain tank to be projected onto the tank profile. We would provide an accurate line drawing to use. The rendering of the tank would act as a 'screen saver' and would animate occasionally by the wheels rolling.

The Foe to Friend exhibition also has another large projection at the beginning of the exhibition as outlined in drawings AV Designs Briefs Appendix E.  NAM would also like the creative audio-visual tenderers to quote for editing this film of Operation Varsity, troops crossing the Rhine after WWII, sub-titling and ensuring the sound recording blends well. Please separate this out from the tank costs as outlined in the pricing document, Appendix  F.  Your pricing should account for the creation and delivery of both the tank projection and the Operation Varsity exhibits to site at NAM.

""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""NAM is staging a temporary exhibition that explores the role of the British Army in Germany post 1945. The exhibition opens to the public on 8th May but is required to be completed by 4th May 2020 to allow for press, PR and a private view to take place. The exhibition runs for 1 year.

As part of the exhibition build the main build contractors are creating a profile of a Chieftain tank in MDF, CNC routed as per drawings A22, A23. 

NAM would like to appoint a creative audio-visual company to create and deliver a sequence of film and animation that will be projected onto the tank.

•	Excerpts from the Lionheart 84 film from the IWM which shows the biggest mobilisation of troops to test and demonstrate the ability of NATO forces to withstand an attack from Russia. 
•	Film of Chieftain manoeuvres from the Allied Museum.
•	Production and Projection of the statistics outlined in Appendix E.

All the above should be merged into a seamless film projection that will be motion triggered when visitors walk in the proximity of the tank profile.

When the film is not triggered, we would like to create a rendering of the Chieftain tank to be projected onto the tank profile. We would provide an accurate line drawing to use. The rendering of the tank would act as a 'screen saver' and would animate occasionally by the wheels rolling.

The Foe to Friend exhibition also has another large projection at the beginning of the exhibition as outlined in drawings AV Designs Briefs Appendix E.  NAM would also like the creative audio-visual tenderers to quote for editing this film of Operation Varsity, troops crossing the Rhine after WWII, sub-titling and ensuring the sound recording blends well. Please separate this out from the tank costs as outlined in the pricing document, Appendix  F.  Your pricing should account for the creation and delivery of both the tank projection and the Operation Varsity exhibits to site at NAM.

178715451,cf_notices,5911a7f4-3e83-46e7-998f-13928c520b0a,ocds-0c46vo-0001-5911a7f4-3e83-46e7-998f-13928c520b0a,["tender"],en-GB,F13394 Home from Hospital Service,"North East Hampshire & Farnham CCG and Surrey Heath CCG are working in collaboration to commission a single Home from Hospital service across both CCG footprints. The overall aim of the Home from Hospital service is to provide a responsive and time-limited service to individuals who are medically fit for discharge from acute hospital or community unit, through providing and signposting onto, advice, information and person centred support for these individuals and their carers to safely resettle at home, and to live healthy and independent lives.

The Service provider(s) will link individuals with appropriate interventions (e.g. volunteers and community groups) that can facilitate support and connections for an individual and or their carer to settle back at home and restore "normal" daily functioning. It will allow people to regain their confidence after a period in hospital or after a short stay in the emergency department in a way that will promote their independence and reduce the likelihood of hospital readmission or Long Term Care - there will be prompt access which enables timely discharge.

Bids from single providers, legally established consortia and/or partnerships are welcome; partnerships should note they must select a lead partner to become the legal entity on the The Service provider(s) will link individuals with appropriate interventions (e.g. volunteers and community groups) that can facilitate support and connections for an individual and or their carer to settle back at home and restore "normal" daily functioning. It will allow people to regain their confidence after a period in hospital or after a short stay in the emergency department in a way that will promote their independence and reduce the likelihood of hospital readmission or Long Term Care - there will be prompt access which enables timely discharge. 

Bids from single providers, legally established consortia and/or partnerships are welcome; partnerships should note they must select a lead partner to become the legal entity on the contract."", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2020-03-25T00:00:00Z"", ""startDate"": ""2020-02-26T16:41:48Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": true, ""isSuitableForVco"": true, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Services""}, ""procurementMethod"": ""open"", ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Open (non-OJEU)"", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T02:11:42.220497+00:00""}",2020-02-26 16:41:48.000000

178715474,cf_notices,de4e0af6-593d-46b2-b240-cee9b823eb29,ocds-0c46vo-0001-de4e0af6-593d-46b2-b240-cee9b823eb29,["tender"],en-GB,EV076 Killingworth Sustainable Retrofit Project Sub-Contractor Packages- Block A 14. Drainage Repairs,"The Authority has secured funding from the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) for the Killingworth Site Sustainable Retrofit project. This project is a combination of refurbishment and replacement of the existing office accommodation, workshop, welfare and other facilities on the site ensuring it 'future proofs' its operations, with energy efficiency and functionality as the key principles using a range of energy efficient systems, alongside energy generation and energy storage/distribution solutions to support a move to an electronic powered operational fleet.

This procurement opportunity relates specifically to Drainage Repairs. North Tyneside Council will be the Principal Contractor for the project therefore tenderers should note that they will be working in the capacity of Sub-Contractor.

Tenderers must be aware that this is an operational site and as such Works must be undertaken taking into consideration neighbouring occupied buildings, vehicle movements and office and field-based employees accessing and attending the site in vehicles and on foot.

The Block A site is very restrictive for access / plant movements and therefore it is strongly recommended that Tenderers undertake a site visit, contact details to make arrangements are contained within the Preambles document in the tender pack.

Tenderers will be required to confirm that they will comply will the Authority's minimum standards in relation to health & safety and mandatory training requirements. All operatives must hold CSCS cards, relevant training certification and any other trade/task specific relevant qualifications.

This package is programmed to be completed from 01/04/2020 (for 3 weeks) All packages are expected to be completed by: 30/09/2020.",30000,GBP,2020-02-26 09:12:48.000000,2020-02-26 09:12:48.000000,2020-03-18 00:00:00.000000,North Tyneside Council,"Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North",North Tyneside,,NE27 0BY,England,Julie Batey,julie.batey@northtyneside.gov.uk,07817574163,,,https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/de4e0af6-593d-46b2-b240-cee9b823eb29,{45000000},2020-02-27 08:25:26.141786,2020-05-08 02:11:42.205078,"{""uri"": ""https://openopps.com/tenders/ocds-0c46vo-0001-de4e0af6-593d-46b2-b240-cee9b823eb29/?format=json"", ""releases"": [{""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-4e1670a1-6cf6-4ebb-b038-668501919941-346109-ntyn001-dn464649-43710965"", ""tag"": [""tender""], ""date"": ""2020-02-26T09:12:48Z"", ""ocid"": ""ocds-0c46vo-0001-de4e0af6-593d-46b2-b240-cee9b823eb29"", ""buyer"": {""name"": ""North Tyneside Council"", ""address"": {""region"": null, ""locality"": ""North Tyneside"", ""postalCode"": ""NE27 0BY"", ""countryName"": ""England"", ""streetAddress"": ""Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North""}, ""contactPoint"": {""uri"": ""http://www.northtyneside.gov.uk/"", ""name"": ""Julie Batey"", ""email"": ""julie.batey@northtyneside.gov.uk"", ""faxNumber"": null, ""telephone"": ""07817574163""}}, ""tender"": {""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-4e1670a1-6cf6-4ebb-b038-668501919941-ntyn001-dn464649-43710965"", ""items"": [{""id"": 1, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""45000000"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-45000000.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Construction work""}}], ""title"": ""EV076 Killingworth Sustainable Retrofit Project Sub-Contractor Packages- Block A 14. The service provider will also be expected to show that they have experience with other public sector organisations and will be required to provide references

176640041,cf_notices,ee53ea89-1a80-4eff-b8e4-6b3e5fa6e9f1,ocds-0c46vo-0001-ee53ea89-1a80-4eff-b8e4-6b3e5fa6e9f1,["tender"],en-GB,2020154/BHR Cortech Datalog5 hardware upgrade Paddock Centre,"

West London NHS Trust is looking for a supplier to install Cortech Datalog 5 hardware to the Paddock Centre located in Berkshire. The scope of this procurement specifically includes: • The backup and verification of all existing Datalog5 system configuration files. • Supply, installation and commissioning of new Datalog5 primary and failover servers and all engineering workstations. • Supply, installation and commissioning of new Mimic server / client machines. • Supply, installation and commissioning of all other engineering workstations. • Supply, installation and commissioning of new control room Datalog5 client machines. • Supply, installation and commissioning of a new incident management suite client machine. This to include additional Graphics card, memory and licencing to operate as a client / MV server. • Replacement and upgrade of the backup control room client machines. This to include additional licencing. • Transfer of all existing integration and device licences • Supply, installation and commissioning of new large format 50-55" LED displays in the control room, incident management suite and backup control room. • Supply, installation and commissioning of new 24" 16:9 displays for Datalog5 client machines. • Supply, installation and configuration of dedicated Datalog MV servers for the control room. • Supply, installation and configuration of Datalog MV licences for all MV servers and client workstations. • Supply, installation and configuration of new integration licences for Datalog MV and Avigilon CCTV recording. Suppliers interested in this opportunity can access documents by logging into the www.lppsourcing.org and searching by the project or Trust name. This tender will be closing at midday 2nd March 2020.",0,GBP,2020-02-17 08:44:06.000000,,2020-03-02 00:00:00.000000,West London Mental Health NHS Trust,West London NHS Trust 1 Armstrong Primarily, these will be in relation to mental health (including self harm), substance misuse (including drugs, alcohol and new psychoactive substances) and domestic violence, but also sexual health, physical health activity and healthy eating.

The Provider will work with and signpost and refer to key partners in order to meet the needs of young people. 177553441,cf_notices,e63a6cbb-58b7-4bd5-9364-0bc7e1c92bc3,ocds-0c46vo-0001-e63a6cbb-58b7-4bd5-9364-0bc7e1c92bc3,["tender"],en-GB,Performance and Learning Management Platform,"Digital Catapult is looking for a partner to provide a SaaS based Performance Management and Learning Management Solution for between 150-200 employees.

Further to gathering feedback from the organisation and in order to streamline and further automate our internal processes, the HR team is looking to source a HR Software system that facilitates a fit for purpose solution for managing workforce performance, to provide access to learning content and underpin the development of our employees. This will be delivered through implementation of a SaaS based Performance Management System and Learning Management System with capabilities to manage performance reviews, individual and team goal tracking, real-time feedback reviews across various stakeholders, and support self / organisation learning and development.

The system should be broad enough to allow management of career paths and link to a learning management system providing a rich catalogue of general L&D content with a UK context (Compliance led, Leadership and Management skills); Webinars and variety of media with ability to edit of build custom content / courses.

The rationale is to streamline the company Performance and L&D process by offering stakeholders a user friendly, online tool to manage performance reviews, personal development and organisation learning.

It will also allow for additional functionalities including secure data storage, reporting and analytics as well as the ability to track career pathing, succession planning and development to support the growth of our talent.
The budget allocation for this project is up to a maximum of £75,000 (excluding VAT) for a 3 year contract.
The initial Contract term shall be for a period of three (3) years with an option for Digital Catapult to extend for up to two further periods of twelve (12) months each
To register an interest in this opportunity and receive full Request for Proposal, please email the buyer directly using the address below: procurement@digicatapult.org.uk

177553465,cf_notices,2bd2d3f9-e8f2-4e03-bccf-0fc5a64aac5f,ocds-0c46vo-0001-2bd2d3f9-e8f2-4e03-bccf-0fc5a64aac5f,["tender"],en-GB,Dynamic Purchasing System - Digital Services,"This Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) will support the Ofgem DDaT team to develop and expand its capabilities with a strategic architecture function, including enterprise, solutions, cyber security and data specialists to support the increasing pace of technological change, and Ofgem and Industry initiatives supporting and enabling the transformation of the energy sector aligned with the HMG Industrial Strategy. 177322485,cf_notices,ef96b33a-9eec-409d-b850-091f8aa82228,ocds-0c46vo-0001-ef96b33a-9eec-409d-b850-091f8aa82228,["tender"],en-GB,PIN/EXPRESSION OF INTEREST ONLY -The Provision of a Female Inpatient Rehabilitation Service (Mental Health - complex needs) On behalf of NHS Bolton Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG),"NHS Bolton CCG would like to invite Expressions of Interest from suitably experienced and capable providers for the Provision of a 12-14 Bed Inpatient Rehabilitation Service for women with complex needs, which will form part of the local mental health recovery and rehabilitation pathway.

The purpose of this market engagement is to assess the level of interest from suitably qualified providers to deliver the service, and to consult with the market on potential service developments following a pilot period.
The service will enable recovery and rehabilitation for individuals with complex mental health needs, and must include:
•
column2: A full MDT;

column1: •
column2: A robust model based on clinically appropriate therapeutic interventions, and recognised outcomes tools;

column1: •
column2: Family/carer support;

column1: •
column2: Access to statutory and non-statutory advocacy; and

column1: •
column2: Ability to support complex presentations including co-morbidities (which may involve physical health issues and other psychiatric diagnoses such as personality disorder and wider issues such as substance misuse, self-harm and forensic histories).

column1: The service will be commissioned using a block contract with an indicative annual contract value of £1,680,000 to £1,747,200 per annum with the contract term being a year with a possible option to extend by a further year under an all-inclusive pricing block contract.

A service specification is being developed to reflect the current requirements of the CCG. The CCG would like potential providers to complete the Market Engagement Questionnaire (MEQ) which provides additional details about the proposed service and will be used to assess the level of interest and review the service specification for any potential service developments.

Any MEQ responses will not be treated as commercially confidential and may be used by the CCG in the final service specification used for the contract but no organisation will be individually identified. This early engagement process will be used to help shape the final version of the specification and to determine the most appropriate route to contract award.

It is likely that this potential contracting opportunity will be subject to a competitive procurement process to enable the CCG to identify the most suitable and qualified provider to deliver the service. A lack of interest being expressed in response to this invitation may be taken as evidence by the CCG that a competitive process may not be required. CONFIRMATION OF YOUR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST IS THEREFORE IMPORTANT.
This advert has been advertised on both Contract Finder and OJEU.

Potential providers wishing to express an interest and submit a completed MEQ located in the document section of EU-Supply by no later than 4pm on 4th March 2020, should register on EU Supply using link https://uk.eu-supply.com and search for Tender Reference 39089 .
For any technical support, please contact the e-tendering helpdesk on 0800 840 2050 or support@eu-supply.com.

177094108,cf_notices,3da56b91-f26e-4bed-8f2d-c49a15a0eda6,ocds-0c46vo-0001-3da56b91-f26e-4bed-8f2d-c49a15a0eda6,["tender"],en-GB,"SUPPLY, DELIVERY AND INSTALLATION OF FURNITURE AND ASSOCIATED SERVICE","The Contract has been offered under RM3812 Supply, Delivery and Installation of Furniture and Associated
Services which will govern any resultant Contract. This competition is established for a single Supplier
Contract for the procurement of Supply, Delivery and Installation of the following
Seat High Back Diner Style Unit
Seat High Back Meeting Booth
Square Coffee Table
oval Coffee Table
Stool Round Blazer
Stool Square Blazer
Single Seat Low Corner Unit
Seater Low Sofa Unit
Seater Low Sofa Corner Unit
Chair VIIP Meeting
The scope of the work will include the complete supply, delivery and installation of the required furniture.
The contract will be for an initial 12 months. The budget for this project, including expenses and any
respondent incentive payments is £73000 (excluding VAT). A detailed breakdown of costs is required
within the price schedule. This Contract will be between the successful Supplier and the Contracting
Authority (not the Crown Commercial Service (CCS), the Agent)
