177093962,cf_notices,6f22643c-6a03-4340-906b-6ccf3a681fd1,ocds-0c46vo-0001-6f22643c-6a03-4340-906b-6ccf3a681fd1,["tender"],en-GB,Refurbishment of Part Ground Floor and Staff Toilets Floors 1-5 Wat Tyler House (West) Swindon,"Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced contractors for the refurbishment of Part Ground Floor and Staff Toilets Floors 1-5 Wat Tyler House (West) Swindon
Project Description
The contractor will be required to undertake the work which is more particularly detailed in the tender documentation with a brief outline below:
•
column2: Internal Refurbishment Works

column1: •
column2: Joinerworks - fitting out

column1: •
column2: Plumbing and Drainage Works

column1: •
column2: Decorations and Finishing including carpeting

column1: •
column2: Electrical & Mechanical Works

column1: •
column2: Associated works including the removal of waste and pricing should include for the disposal of waste material and clean up of works as appropriate

column1: The contract term will be 16 weeks
Full details relating to the Works are provided in the tender documents.

Swindon Borough Council will also be allocating two dates for site visits (2nd/3rd March 2020). Please see section 3 of the Invitation to Tender Document (ITT) for details of how to register to attend.
The relevant tender documents are included within this project webpage as attachments.

Tender clarifications to be submitted in writing via e-mail, including the project name clearly in the e-mail title, to TenderingHousingProperty@swindon.gov.uk by 10th March 2020, 14:00:00 hrs UK Local time. Please do not contact the buyer directly.

The Council's responses to these clarification questions will be uploaded as attachments on the project webpage attachments section. Therefore it is the Contractor's responsibility to check the site regularly for updates to clarifications, as you will not be advised when updates have been made.
Tender Responses are required to be submitted no later than 20th March 2020 12:00:00 hrs UK Local time by e-mail to the address below stating the reference number and title in the subject box.
TenderingHousingProperty@swindon.gov.uk
In the event of difficulties downloading tender documents, please email: TenderingHousingProperty@swindon.gov.uk, Please do not contact the buyer directly.

Please note that this project has been advertised on Contracts Finder/ other web portals, however, Supplying the South West Portal, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, is the only portal that includes all the relevant documents required to respond to this opportunity, bearing Project Id: DN465793
We would encourage you to click on the 'Register interest' button to help the Council monitor the level of interest in this opportunity.
No Tender submissions will be considered without completing the tender documents in full including attachments and returning them in alignment with the instructions within the tender documents.

177094002,cf_notices,a8b8687e-1ef1-4b77-8c6b-0917dde87e8e,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a8b8687e-1ef1-4b77-8c6b-0917dde87e8e,["tender"],en-GB,RE05866 - NON- HIGHWAYS RESURFACING PROGRAMME 2020/201,"The works comprise the resurfacing and full construction of paths, roads, playgrounds, car parks and the like across the city. Associated works could include fencing, drainage, the construction of steps and ramps and the installation of street furniture. Sites will be released to the Contractor on Works Orders and could range from a single Order for a patch repair (minimum value £500) to an order for a new car park or multiple sites across the city (maximum value £150,000). No continuity of work can be guaranteed and the Contractor will be expected to mobilise within 4 weeks of receiving an Order. The Contract Period will initially be for 12 months up to 25th June 2021 with a provision to extend a further 36 months subject to annual review. The reviews will take place in March and the respective 12 months extension will be dependent on budget availability and continuing good performance by the Contractor. Contractor performance will be measured using the KPI's outlined in Appendix H (see Preliminaries Item 1.8.6.8). The quantities in the Schedule of Works with Approximate Quantities are based on the first 12 months budget only. Following a successful review and contract extension the Contractors rates will be subject to an annual inflationary adjustment (see Preliminaries Item 31.04). The Contractor shall allow in his rates for any additional costs in relation to out of sequence or uneconomical working methods and disruption due to the aforementioned criteria.",0,GBP,2020-02-19 177093994,cf_notices,0d80aa41-b900-4593-b89c-5e4a846e631a,ocds-0c46vo-0001-0d80aa41-b900-4593-b89c-5e4a846e631a,["tender"],en-GB,"Extended Activities, 11 week Play Scheme and Toy Loan Service for Families of Children with Disabilities and Additional Needs ('Short Break' Services)","Hartlepool Borough Council are seeking tender submissions from appropriately qualified and experienced organisations with the capacity to deliver extended activities and play scheme provision together with a specialist toy loan service for families of children with disabilities and additional needs living in the Hartlepool area.

This service will contribute to the 'Breaks for Carers of Disabled Children' Regulations (2011) and The 'Local Offer of Services' as detailed in Chapter 4 of the 'Special Educational Needs and Disability Code of Practice 0 - 25 Years' (Statutory Guidance).

The service will also contribute to the outcomes specified in the 2008 'Children and Young Persons Act' (s25), which details the statutory duty of local authorities to assist individuals who care for disabled children to continue to do so as effectively as possible.                                Organisations wishing to register an interest and download the tender documentation, should apply via the NEPO Portal only.
https://procontract.due-north.com
Registration is Free.
All completed tender documentation must be returned via the NEPO Portal Only and by no later than 14:00hrs on MONDAY 9th MARCH 2020

176866128,cf_notices,2f9ad89e-cdb1-4521-88cc-73fc1a87c1b8,ocds-0c46vo-0001-2f9ad89e-cdb1-4521-88cc-73fc1a87c1b8,["tender"],en-GB,The Outlook for Heritage 2020-2045,"Historic England is seeking horizon-scanning advice on the main drivers of change affecting the historic environment sector in England on both 10-year and 25-year timescales. This will help not only Historic England itself but also sector partners to anticipate and prepare for change so that heritage sector will be both more resilient and better able to plan strategically. We are as interested in drivers of societal change as we are in economic and environmental change.

A three-year contract is envisaged under which the Year 1 report will be reviewed and refreshed annually.  We anticipate this to be a relatively quick piece of work. Our expectation, therefore, is that the final product will be submitted by 31 March 2020.

We are as interested in drivers of societal change as we are in economic and environmental change.\r\n      A three-year contract is envisaged under which the Year 1 report will be reviewed and refreshed annually.  We anticipate this to be a relatively quick piece of work. 176866071,cf_notices,35ac618e-16e6-4547-84c4-eb65bd3936c6,ocds-0c46vo-0001-35ac618e-16e6-4547-84c4-eb65bd3936c6,["tender"],en-GB,Equine Veterinary Service,"GMP are seeking to award a contract for the provision of a Equine Veterinary advice and treatment service.
The Mounted Unit of GMP has an establishment of approximately 20 horses, stabled at the Hough End Centre in South Manchester.
The unit operates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week and the horses are required to work a variety of shifts.
On average, the horses work undersaddle 2-4 hours a day, 6 days a week, mainly walking on roads. They are predominantly hunter types and stand between 16.2hh and 17.3hh.

The diet of the horses is roughage based, consisting of haylage, alfalfa and a balancer. They are predominantly stabled on rubber mats with a shallow layer of bedding, which is currently chopped rape straw, and with minimal access to turnout.",130000,GBP,2020-02-18 09:02:16.000000,,2020-03-20 00:00:00.000000,Greater Manchester Combined Authority - 176640200,cf_notices,6555eef6-ae91-4dfb-8684-67a0686c971c,ocds-0c46vo-0001-6555eef6-ae91-4dfb-8684-67a0686c971c,["tender"],en-GB,LPFA Internal Audit Services - Contracts Finder Notice,"The London Pensions Fund Authority (LPFA) is required to have an internal audit function under the accounts and audit regulations. These regulations place responsibility on the authority for maintaining an adequate and effective internal audit service.

The LPFA Audit and Risk Committee is responsible to the LPFA Board for ensuring that there is an adequate system of internal control, and that it is maintained and complied with on a routine basis. The lead officer responsible for maintaining the system of internal control is the Managing Director of LPFA, although the LPFA acknowledges that internal controls are a collective responsibility with the LPFA Audit & Risk Committee and the Section 151 Officer also has responsibility in this area.

The LPFA will prepare an Annual Governance Statement to review the effectiveness of the system of internal control, and this is signed by the LPFA Managing Director and the Chair of the LPFA Audit & Risk Committee. This is supported by a statement from the Head of the Internal Audit function on the effectiveness of the system of internal control.

The LPFA Audit & Risk Committee has the responsibility for reviewing the effectiveness of the internal audit function. The Committee will receive regular reports from the internal audit provider, and the senior internal auditor will attend the Audit & Risk Committee meetings.

The Head of Internal Audit, to be provided by the supplier, will be required to work with other elements of the audit services. This includes the LPFA's external auditors (currently Grant Thornton) but may also require working with the internal and external audit service of Local Pensions Partnerships, (currently Deloitte internal and Grant Thornton external).

LPFA may also make use of external consultants to support organisational development. The internal audit function may identify areas for external consultancy to advise on, and support implementation of, new systems following recommendations from external consultants.
The estimated value of the contract is £80,000 to £100,000 (excluding VAT) per year. Further details about the services required are set out in the invitation to tender.

Contracts Finder Notice"", ""value"": {""amount"": 100000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""status"": ""unsuccessful"", ""minValue"": {""amount"": 80000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""documents"": [{""id"": ""tender_url"", ""url"": ""https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/6555eef6-ae91-4dfb-8684-67a0686c971c"", ""format"": ""text/html"", ""language"": ""en"", ""documentType"": ""tenderNotice""}], ""milestones"": [{""id"": 1, ""title"": ""Contract start"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-04-01T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract start date""}, {""id"": 2, ""title"": ""Contract end"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2023-03-31T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""The London Pensions Fund Authority (LPFA) is required to have an internal audit function under the accounts and audit regulations. These regulations place responsibility on the authority for maintaining an adequate and effective internal audit service.

The LPFA Audit and Risk Committee is responsible to the LPFA Board for ensuring that there is an adequate system of internal control, and that it is maintained and complied with on a routine basis. The lead officer responsible for maintaining the system of internal control is the Managing Director of LPFA, although the LPFA acknowledges that internal controls are a collective responsibility with the LPFA Audit & Risk Committee and the Section 151 Officer also has responsibility in this area.

The LPFA will prepare an Annual Governance Statement to review the effectiveness of the system of internal control, and this is signed by the LPFA Managing Director and the Chair of the LPFA Audit & Risk Committee. This is supported by a statement from the Head of the Internal Audit function on the effectiveness of the system of internal control.

The LPFA Audit & Risk Committee has the responsibility for reviewing the effectiveness of the internal audit function. The Committee will receive regular reports from the internal audit provider, and the senior internal auditor will attend the Audit & Risk Committee meetings.
The Head of Internal Audit, to be provided by the supplier, will be required to work with other elements of the audit services. This includes the LPFA's external auditors (currently Grant Thornton) but may also require working with the internal and external audit service of Local Pensions Partnerships, (currently Deloitte internal and Grant Thornton external).

LPFA may also make use of external consultants to support organisational development. The internal audit function may identify areas for external consultancy to advise on, and support implementation of, new systems following recommendations from external consultants.

The estimated value of the contract is £80,000 to £100,000 (excluding VAT) per year. Further details about the services required are set out in the invitation to tender.

176640207,cf_notices,d3fc274e-a4ac-4b2d-bfda-93f3eae78846,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d3fc274e-a4ac-4b2d-bfda-93f3eae78846,["tender"],en-GB,Mid & South Essex STP Lloyd George Digitisation Service,"The Mid and South Essex Sustainable Transformation Plan (MSE STP) wish to establish a single Provider contract for provision of Lloyd George (LG) Medical Records Digitisation Services in order to best utilise current Estates space and support Primary Care. The Contract term will be 12 months (1st April 2020 to 31st March 2021), with the option to extend the contract for 12 months (1st April 2021 to 31st March 2022) at the sole discretion of the Commissioners.

NHS Castle Point and Rochford Clinical Commissioning Group on behalf of MSE STP secured funding to enable circa 50 priority GP Practices sites to fully digitalise their LG wallets. This procurement relates to Phase 1 of the programme requiring the provision of the service for an estimated 578,632 LG wallets across circa 50 GP Practices, by no later than 31st March 2021.

If funding becomes available there may be the potential to roll out the digitisation of LG wallets to other GP Practices within the MSE STP footprint, however at this stage, funding has only been secured for Phase 1 (circa 50 prioritised Primary Care sites, see Specification for further detail).

The estimated potential aggregate contract value over the contract term (1 year + 1 year extension) is £4,338,246 GBP. This figure encompasses the Actual Available Budget for Phase 1, in addition to any anticipated future phases being implemented during the first year and or subsequent extension period, should such 12-month extension be activated by commissioners. The Actual Available Budget for Phase 1, which acts as an affordability envelope for this procurement for the purposes of bidding (not including any extension period) is (net of VAT) £1,537,887 GBP.  Any bids received in excess of such affordability envelope will be rejected as non-compliant.

Any subsequent Phase(s) (and prices associated with such Phase(s)), will be mutually agreed between Provider and Commissioner using prices submitted for Phase 1 via appropriate Contract Variation mechanisms. It's anticipated that any subsequent Phase(s) will cover outstanding LG Wallets (indicatively 1,024,615) across remaining GP Practices in the MSE STP. The additional contract value communicated in the Contract Notice (£2,800,358 GBP) that's over and above the Actual Available Budget (£1,537,887 GBP), is indicative and provided solely for purposes of future proofing this contract, should the Commissioner secure additional funding to implement subsequent Phase(s). Commissioners may wish to and as such reserve the right to expand services during the lifetime of the contract potentially resulting in subsequent Phases of delivery then that set out in the specification at the time of contract award. As such, Bidders should be aware that after the award of contract, there is a possibility that the successful Bidder may be offered a contract variation in accordance with Regulation 72(1)(a) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, to include an indicative number of additional wallets.",4338246,GBP,2020-02-17 16:53:54.000000,2020-02-17 16:53:54.000000,2020-02-27 00:00:00.000000,Attain,"Pearl To manufacture and install moisture resistant lay in grid suspended ceilings.
Harrogate Borough Council will ensure that the working area will be isolated from other workers/contractors during the installation as specified in the contractor RAMS.

Price to include the supply of a box of spare tiles for each ceiling system on completion, plus, delivery/carriage charges and any hire/platform equipment required to carry out the works. See www.yortender.co.uk for details.

168017233,cf_notices,a3109b37-3f07-474c-96d5-e1400b66327c,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a3109b37-3f07-474c-96d5-e1400b66327c,["tender"],en-GB,Cornwall Music Education Hub - Vocal Strategy 2020/2021,"Cornwall Council, the lead partner of the Cornwall Music Education Hub (CMEH) is seeking to contract a supplier to develop and lead its Vocal Strategy as outlined in the delivery plan approved by The Arts Council.

The contracted provider can be a self-employed individual, or a named individual from an organisation.  The contract requires the development of a dynamic and joined up vocal strategy for Cornwall to ensure that every pupil has the chance to sing regularly and that inspiring vocal activities of all genres and styles (including choirs and other vocal ensembles) are available to all children and young people.  The deliverer will also strive to elevate the quality of vocal activity across all genres of singing, including choral part singing, through training and resources.

column2: Scope

column1: •
column2: To ensure children at every Cornish school have the opportunity to participate in regular singing

column1: •
column2: To encourage and support all schools in developing singing in their schools

column1: •
column2: To promote and support the development of boys' singing and singing for the changing voice

column1: •
column2: To link in with regional choirs for both boys and girls

column1: •
column2: To identify and develop intergenerational vocal opportunities

column1: •
column2: To link in with the CMEH County Choirs

column1: •
column2: To provide training to school staff to embed singing as a cross-curricular tool and develop supporting resources.

column1: •
column2: To plan and deliver a minimum of 3 large community events per year to provide performance opportunities for choirs

column1: •
column2: To provide the minimum of 2 opportunities per year for young singers to work with professional singers of different styles

column1: •
column2: To plan and deliver CPD through regional termly network meetings and a minimum of one annual training event for teachers and singing leaders

column1: •
column2: To identify additional CPD opportunities through links with national partners to elevate the quality of choral direction

column1: •
column2: To build links with local community vocal groups

column1: •
column2: To work with partners on developing the role of young vocal leaders

column1:

With the initial purchase and installation of Butt of Lewis and Cape Wrath Long Range Lanterns to the specification as detailed in the tender document. The contract will include maintenance and support as detailed within the tender documents.

168017226,cf_notices,0970e572-f833-4345-afb0-15d601ad51cc,ocds-0c46vo-0001-0970e572-f833-4345-afb0-15d601ad51cc,["tender"],en-GB,Employee Mindfulness,"In order to support the Council to fulfil its obligations to members of staff in respect of their emotional resilience and wellbeing both at work and in their personal life, East Riding of Yorkshire Council wish to commission a programme of mindfulness workshops and training courses for its employees.  The aim of this service is to build people's capacity to thrive, and to create greater resilience to help them deal with issues encountered throughout their private and professional lives.

The Council has been running a successful Mindfulness programme for staff members over the past 5 years.  The new service will include a re-focus on using mindfulness for capacity building to enable people to thrive in all areas of their life.
Other new areas of focus are the addition of Compassionate Care for Unpaid Carers and Retirement Transition for those who are coming to the end of their career.
As a part of this commitment to our staff, we wish to procure a qualified provider to deliver a further two (2) year programme, with options to extend for up to a further two (2) years.

""description"": ""In order to support the Council to fulfil its obligations to members of staff in respect of their emotional resilience and wellbeing both at work and in their personal life, East Riding of Yorkshire Council wish to commission a programme of mindfulness workshops and training courses for its employees.  The aim of this service is to build people's capacity to thrive, and to create greater resilience to help them deal with issues encountered throughout their private and professional lives.

The Council has been running a successful Mindfulness programme for staff members over the past 5 years.  The new service will include a re-focus on using mindfulness for capacity building to enable people to thrive in all areas of their life.
  Other new areas of focus are the addition of Compassionate Care for Unpaid Carers and Retirement Transition for those who are coming to the end of their career.
As a part of this commitment to our staff, we wish to procure a qualified provider to deliver a further two (2) year programme, with options to extend for up to a further two (2) years.

168017298,cf_notices,f8d3721b-266c-4d7f-ac41-099bac04fb30,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f8d3721b-266c-4d7f-ac41-099bac04fb30,["tender"],en-GB,North Park Furnace - Fernhurst -  Repair Project,"Expressions of interest are invited from suitably qualified contractors for the conservation and repair works to this Scheduled Monument site in West Sussex. The works to the historic iron furnace site, the pond dam and surrounding area include water management, groundworks, structural concrete and masonry repairs. Works include:
- Temporary and enabling works to manage water levels and site safety further to:
- The repair and conservation of the northern sluice structure including:
- Repairs and alterations to brick built sump,
- Repairs to the concrete culvert and retaining wall,
- Attenuation and erosion control measures to the
outlet area,
- Construction of new sluice gate control measures
and access platforms.
- Repair and conservation of the Furnace archaeological site including:
- Attenuation of water flows,
- Repair of masonry structures
- Protective groundworks to adjacent banks with a vegetated retaining wall.
- The repair and conservation of the southern spillway including:
- Reconstruction of the stone retaining wall,
- Repairs to the wing walls, barrel vault and stone
weir channel.
- Erosion protection measures to the inlet and outlet.
- Completion of groundworks and erosion protection measures to link the channels from the north sluice and southern spillway.

168017299,cf_notices,47798cdb-d8d4-49fd-ae66-db949e27458d,ocds-0c46vo-0001-47798cdb-d8d4-49fd-ae66-db949e27458d,["tender"],en-GB,Public Value Report,"The Supplier will produce a report; a desk based assessment of water companies' published material relating to company purpose and public value commitments. This will consist of a review and assessment of the various reports and position statements on social impact and public purpose to identify their credibility, how they are validated or verified and to draw out best practice.
The report must:

- Assess the nature of company reporting; establish how companies are reporting on public value and the validity of the statements. Establish whether they are forward looking or retrospective, and whether they are adding real public value in how they carry out their core activities.
- Assess how public value is reported in other sectors, and identify examples of best practice.
- Provide recommendations for a framework for evaluation, and how Ofwat can monitor and assess company reporting on public value.
- Be consistent with Ofwat's strategy, Time to Act, Together, to encourage water companies to deliver greater public value.
- Be consistent with Ofwat's Board Leadership, Transparency and Governance Principles 2019.
- Anything else the Supplier identifies that is not listed above to be agreed in advance.
Skills and experience

Our research partner should have credibility and ideally be able to support our strategy on delivering public value over the long-term. We will need to see that the research partner has examples of previous research and assessments in this area.
Key deliverables
Deliverable 1 - Outline methodology. The methodology will outline the research and assessment plan including the documents to be included and the areas that will be explored.

Deliverable 2 - Interim report on initial findings. Provide an interim report on the initial findings. The initial findings will be reviewed and assessed by the Ofwat project lead, Mark Anderson, before moving to the final stage.

Deliverable 3 - Final report on the assessment, examples of best practice and recommendations for a framework for evaluation. The final report will be reviewed, and providing expectations are met, signed off by the Ofwat project lead, Mark Anderson.
Timescales
The Supplier will provide the key deliverables in accordance with the following timescales:
Key Deliverables (date)
Deliverable 1: Outline methodology (5 February  2020)
Deliverable 2: Interim report on initial findings (28 February 2020)
Deliverable 3: Final report (31 March 2020)

Any changes to the delivery date/s for the key deliverables will be agreed in advance between the parties. All work must be completed by 31 March 2020.",29000,GBP,2020-01-10 17:45:05.000000,,2020-01-22 00:00:00.000000,Water Services Regulation Authority (Ofwat),Centre City Tower 7 Hill Street,Birmingham,,B5 4UA,England,Lena Cluxton,lena.cluxton@ofwat.gov.uk,+44 1216447534,,,https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/47798cdb-d8d4-49fd-ae66-db949e27458d,{79400000},2020-01-11 170950349,cf_notices,25b6f521-0cf9-4c7d-a140-a0dba3dbb633,ocds-0c46vo-0001-25b6f521-0cf9-4c7d-a140-a0dba3dbb633,["tender"],en-GB,Clapham Manor Primary School ~ Cleaning Services Tender,"The successful Supplier will be required to provide cleaning services at Clapham Manor Primary School, Belmont Road, Clapham, London, SW4 0BZ.
There are approximately 420 children aged 5-11 years split over two sites: the primary school is located on the main site and the nursery on the second site.

Following a building extension in 2006, the overall design re-used an existing 125-year Victorian school by giving it a new lease of life by adding a new four-storey extension joined to the existing school with a glazed link building, providing access at each level. The ground floor of the new building is glazed, and three stories above are each marked by six bands of coloured glazing. The new building was nominated for the RIBA Stirling Prize, and came second.",0,GBP,2020-01-23 15:20:02.000000,,2020-02-21 00:00:00.000000,Clapham Manor Primary School,Belmont Road Clapham,London,,SW4 170282686,cf_notices,8a0eb302-a9e9-46c2-b2a2-3db695ca4d23,ocds-0c46vo-0001-8a0eb302-a9e9-46c2-b2a2-3db695ca4d23,["tender"],en-GB,Cambridge City Council - Building Cleaning,"Cambridge City Council (The Council) is calling for bids to fulfill its building cleaning services for the city across three core lots and two additional specialist cleaning contract lots, resulting in the following five lot structure as follows:
•
column2: Lot 1: Administration, commercial buildings, community centres and operational buildings

column1: •
column2: Lot 2: Public toilets

column1: •
column2: Lot 3: City Homes communal areas and sheltered housing schemes

column1: •
column2: Lot 4: Multi-storey car parks

column1: •
column2: Lot 5: Window cleaning

column1: Suppliers are invited to bid for one or more of the five lots, in any combination.

Please note the current arrangement is with a single supplier and as such the exact nature of the TUPE requirements and who transfer to whom will not be known until the selection process is complete and the number of successful tenderers has been identified.

A contract term is initially 3 years, with an option to extend by 2 years then up to 2 further years, if the supplier is performing satisfactorily, and the service can be shown to continue to provide best value to the Council; this gives a maximum possible contract length of 7 years.
Assessment - price: quality tender assessment split of 40% price: 60% quality

The current contract is due to end on the 19th June 2020 and it is anticipated that the start date of the new contract will be begin on the current contract end date (20th June 167574182,cf_notices,cd2094e5-2684-428b-8c2d-2246363ef3a2,ocds-0c46vo-0001-cd2094e5-2684-428b-8c2d-2246363ef3a2,["tender"],en-GB,Short Term Vehicle & Plant Hire Framework,"The Council operates a fleet of approximately 700 items comprising of cars, small vans, mini buses, tippers, road sweepers, refuse collection vehicles, trailers and plant equipment.

The Council is seeking a comprehensive framework of Suppliers who can provide a range of vehicles/plant on a short term hire basis as and when required. If the required vehicle/plant cannot be supplied via this framework the Council at their discretion may source via an alternative method or framework agreement.

The annual expenditure for short term hire is estimated to be circa £320,000 pounds based on previous expenditure across a number of Suppliers. This value should be only used to indicate possible levels of business for this contract. The Council cannot guarantee any particular volume of business to any Supplier.

The contract will be awarded initially for a two year period; the Council reserves the right to extend for a further 2 year period.  The extension is subject to quality of service and price remaining acceptable to the Council.  The maximum contract period is 4 years.
Prices are to be fixed for the initial two years and may be reviewed at the extension point.
The vehicles/plant will be hired for use by various Council departments and driven by their employees.
The Supplier shall supply vehicles/plant to the Council, as and when required.  The requirements of each hire shall be specified at the time of ordering.
The Council will use the rates submitted by Suppliers to select the lowest price for the type of vehicle/plant required when selecting a Supplier for an ad-hoc hire request.
The Council may request ad-hoc hire of specialist vehicles/plant from any Supplier as and when necessary.

179172503,cf_notices,d62aaf97-dffa-4bf0-98bc-174b2639fb1d,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d62aaf97-dffa-4bf0-98bc-174b2639fb1d,["tender"],en-GB,In Lieu of Short-Term Enablement,"The In Lieu of Short-Term Enablement Service is for adults who have been assessed as requiring a period of intermediate care whilst determining their longer term support needs.  The Service is designed to provide a high quality locality based intermediate care service.  The Service will provide flexible, intensive, consistent and integrated short term support to enable an adult to remain at home or return to their normal place of residence.  The Service will provide support to adults to maximise their independence and achieve their optimum level of function, usually in their own home (but support could also be delivered within other settings including a relative's home, a residential setting or temporary accommodation), including a rapid response when required.  This could be to enable an early and safe transfer from hospital, to prevent admission to hospital, or to meet an immediate support requirement within the community.",0,GBP,2020-02-28 179172521,cf_notices,a2468a49-58b1-4eb9-9a19-5749efe3cb28,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a2468a49-58b1-4eb9-9a19-5749efe3cb28,["tender"],en-GB,Provision of Family Group Conferences 2020,"Provision of Family Group Conferences 2020 - Open Tender Procedure
Dorset Council is seeking tenders from suitably experienced and capable service providers for a Family Group Conference (FGC) Service.

A Family Group Conference (FGC) is a decision making and planning process facilitated independently, where the wider family and friend's network agree and make plans and decisions for children and young people who
•
column2: have been identified as being at risk

column1: •
column2: and are in need of a plan that will safeguard and promote their welfare

column1: •
column2: and which will address the problems identified by professionals who know the child.

column1: Family Group Conferences are arranged and co-ordinated by a Service Provider following an appropriate referral. They can be held for a variety of reasons related to the welfare of the child or young person. An FGC can involve all family members, friends and other adults who the family feel can contribute to making plans for the children. The decision makers at family group conferences are the family members and not the professionals. Professionals though, can also be included in the process as appropriate and with the agreement of the family.

Dorset Council has commissioned the use of Family Group Conferences since late 2015 initially as a short-term pilot scheme and then through a longer formal contract.  Demand for the service has grown quickly. It is anticipated to increase further as the benefits of FGCs become more widely known.
The Service Provider shall:
•
column2: Organise all Family Group Conferences and FGC Review Meeting arrangements,

column1: •
column2: Ensure participation of parents/carers and families,

column1: •
column2: Build and maintain relationships with other services

column1: •
column2: and meet all the requirements of the service specification attached to this tender.

column1: The Service Specification also details the service aims and objectives, description of the service and eligibility, staffing requirements, referral process, performance management and reporting.
This tender relates to provisions for children, young people, adults and their families.

The contract will commence from 1st August 2020 and will run for a period of 1 year with the possibility of 2 further 12-month extension periods.",0,GBP,2020-02-28 11:52:22.000000,2020-02-28 ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2021-07-31T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""Provision of Family Group Conferences 2020 - Open Tender Procedure

Dorset Council is seeking tenders from suitably experienced and capable service providers for a Family Group Conference (FGC) Service.
A Family Group Conference (FGC) is a decision making and planning process facilitated independently, where the wider family and friend's network agree and make plans and decisions for children and young people who 
•	have been identified as being at risk
•	and are in need of a plan that will safeguard and promote their welfare
•	and which will address the problems identified by professionals who know the child.

Family Group Conferences are arranged and co-ordinated by a Service Provider following an appropriate referral. They can be held for a variety of reasons related to the welfare of the child or young person. An FGC can involve all family members, friends and other adults who the family feel can contribute to making plans for the children. The decision makers at family group conferences are the family members and not the professionals. Professionals though, can also be included in the process as appropriate and with the agreement of the family.

Dorset Council has commissioned the use of Family Group Conferences since late 2015 initially as a short-term pilot scheme and then through a longer formal contract.  Demand for the service has grown quickly. It is anticipated to increase further as the benefits of FGCs become more widely known. 

The Service Provider shall:
•	Organise all Family Group Conferences and FGC Review Meeting arrangements,
•	Ensure participation of parents/carers and families,
•	Build and maintain relationships with other services
•	and meet all the requirements of the service specification attached to this tender.

The Service Specification also details the service aims and objectives, description of the service and eligibility, staffing requirements, referral process, performance management and reporting.

This tender relates to provisions for children, young people, adults and their families.

The contract will commence from 1st August 2020 and will run for a period of 1 year with the possibility of 2 further 12-month extension periods."", ""supplyChain"": false, ""hasEnquiries"": null, ""tenderPeriod"": {""endDate"": ""2020-03-30T00:00:00Z"", ""startDate"": ""2020-02-28T11:52:22Z""}, ""awardCriteria"": null, ""submissionMethod"": null, ""xClassifications"": {""isSuitableForSme"": true, ""isSuitableForVco"": true, ""ojeuContractType"": ""Services""}, ""procurementMethod"": null, ""eligibilityCriteria"": null, ""awardCriteriaDetails"": null, ""submissionMethodDetails"": ""Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section."", ""procurementMethodDetails"": ""Open procedure"", ""procurementMethodRationale"": """"}, ""language"": ""en-GB"", ""initiationType"": ""tender""}], ""publisher"": {""uid"": ""https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733"", ""uri"": ""https://openopps.com"", ""name"": ""Open Opps"", ""scheme"": ""Companies House""}, ""publishedDate"": ""2020-05-08T02:11:42.006986+00:00""}",2020-02-28 11:52:22.000000

178938341,cf_notices,8179333b-d1c3-41b0-b0c7-e154b488d0a4,ocds-0c46vo-0001-8179333b-d1c3-41b0-b0c7-e154b488d0a4,["tender"],en-GB,Humanoid Robot,"2517/019/CW/CYMRU/20       Humanoid Robot
The University of Sheffield wishes to invite tenders for a Humanoid Robot on behalf of the Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre CYMRU, Chester Road, CH4 0DH.
Scope of Requirement

AMRC Cymru has a requirement for a humanoid robotic system integrated with a serial robot arm for research, development and demonstration activities. These devices shall be delivered and commissioned at our facilities in Broughton, Flintshire, CH4 0DH.

The key output of the AMRC Cymru will be to advance the adoption, within Welsh industry, of advanced manufacturing technologies through the development of automation, digital or high value design solutions. This tender relates to the provision of facilities at AMRC Cymru to promote the further development of the food and drink industry in Wales.

The humanoid robot will act as the interface to connected systems allowing user inputs in various formats to be interpreted and used (voice, touchscreen) and to assist in disseminating output information to users. This includes, for this Tender, jogging the serial arm robot and programming via the humanoid robot interfaces.
Tender Process and Documentation:
This procurement is an open procedure conducted in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.
Closing date for receipt of tenders: 9th March 2020 at 12 noon (UK time).

178938460,cf_notices,d7af1daf-6d65-48fa-bdf4-5591f2f03fcb,ocds-0c46vo-0001-d7af1daf-6d65-48fa-bdf4-5591f2f03fcb,["tender"],en-GB,Contract for Malton and Norton Footway Lighting refurbishment and Part Night Lighting,"The Council is responsible for 593 footway lighting assets across the District. The Council now wishes to invite quotes for the delivery of a programme of refurbishment and upgrade approximately 277 assets in the Malton and Norton area and to enable 'part night lighting' of the assets in the majority of cases. This tender excludes the 'heritage' lighting in Malton Town Centre and Old Malton. The upgrades will improve the quality and efficiency of the lighting and ensure that the assets are fit for purpose and potential innovations in street lighting in future.
Full specification details are provided on page 10 of the ITT document.

178938477,cf_notices,1ca20f8b-4405-4d07-8a80-7b3396333d65,ocds-0c46vo-0001-1ca20f8b-4405-4d07-8a80-7b3396333d65,["tender"],en-GB,DPS Adult Education,"Adult Education Budget (AEB) is allocated to providers by the Education & Skills Funding Agency (ESFA) on an annual basis. Cheshire West and Chester Council receives AEB funding for the purpose of supporting flexible tailored programmes of learning targeted at those furthest from engaging in learning or the workplace. In providing accessible high-quality education and skills provision Cheshire West & Chester Council offers its residents opportunities to gain the skills needed for entering and sustaining work, an apprenticeship/traineeship, or other further learning.

Through this Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) - under the light touch regime, Cheshire West & Chester Council (CW&C) is looking for the opportunity to develop new relationships with post-16 skills and training providers. Providers should focus on progression outcomes for learners and ensure provision, even at lower levels, is clearly aligned to the needs of employers and growth sectors within the borough.   All documents are available on The Chest, www.the-chest.org.uk   Please register your interest and download the documents.

178715427,cf_notices,97cebaec-f95b-4292-b395-8848a015c230,ocds-0c46vo-0001-97cebaec-f95b-4292-b395-8848a015c230,["tender"],en-GB,Passenger Transport Services Framework,"Bromley Council is inviting offers from transport and taxi service providers (taxis, minibuses, coaches), to deliver these services to local residents. We are keen to secure services to support wheelchair accessibility.
The Council's Passenger Transport Services Framework will provide transport services to children, young people and adults, both with and without additional needs.

Clients could have a range of needs including; being wheelchair users and individuals with mobility needs, learning needs, sensory impairment, hidden disabilities, or a combination of these. In some cases, a passenger assistant will be required.
The type of vehicle that can be used is flexible as long as it meets the required specification.
We want to engage with suppliers who will:
- Work closely with us and understand our needs.
- Demonstrate flexibility and react quickly to changing service demands to support changes to the Council's requirements and our residents.
- Be innovative and efficient in the delivery of passenger transport services.
- Conduct their business in a socially responsible and ethical way.

Currently approximately 900 children, young people and adults over the age of 18 attend over 100 different venues, with 37 of these situated within the Borough and 63 are situated out of the Borough. The majority of these passengers (~75%) attend venues in the Borough. Educational establishments operate throughout the academic year from September to July with half term and term breaks. Arrival times vary from 8AM to 9AM and departure times vary from 2:30PM to 4PM. Further to this, approximately 210 adult clients attend 12 day activity venues. These services are required throughout the calendar year (closed bank holidays) and operate between 7:45AM to 10:30AM in the morning, and 2:45PM to 5:30PM in the afternoon.

The Council is reopening this opportunity for a limited period in conformity with 76 (4) of the Public Contracts Regulation 2015 due to feedback received from a number of tenderers regarding technical issues with receiving notifications about this opportunity.
PREVIOUS APPLICANTS NEED NOT APPLY

The tender opportunity will be run through the London Tenders Procurement Portal and you will need to register your company with the portal as soon as possible (if you have not already done so) at www.londontenders.org to ensure that you are able to access and submit the relevant documents online. This opportunity will be conducted under the Light Touch Regime.",44000000,GBP,2020-02-26 15:24:30.000000,,2020-03-11 00:00:00.000000,London Borough of Bromley,Bromley Civic Centre Stockwell Close,Bromley,,BR1 3UH,United Kingdom,Lorraine Baker,procurement@bromley.gov.uk,+44 178481893,cf_notices,4b50603e-b386-4d0a-b277-834deaf5f15d,ocds-0c46vo-0001-4b50603e-b386-4d0a-b277-834deaf5f15d,["tender"],en-GB,WISH Communications Advisor,"IPPF is a global service provider and a leader advocate of sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) for all. IPPF provides SRHR services in 172 countries and runs approximately 65,000 service points worldwide. IPPF is currently implementing The Women's Integrated Sexual Health (WISH2ACTION - W2A) programme.

WISH2ACTION - W2A programme is the UK Government's flagship health programme designed to transform the lives of millions of women and girls. Funded by the UK's Department for International Development (DFID), WISH will provide integrated and holistic sexual and reproductive healthcare to millions of additional users across 27 countries in Africa and South Asia from 2018-2021.

Through a consortium of IPPF Member Associations (MAs) and five internationally recognized organizations and led by IPPF, WISH2ACTION prioritizes the most underserved women and girls, particularly youth under 20, the very poor, and other marginalized populations (including people with disability, people displaced or affected by humanitarian crisis, and people living in hard-to-reach areas). Areas of integrated service delivery supported through WISH2ACTION include comprehensive family planning services, safe abortion and post abortion care, STI and HIV testing and treatment, counselling, SGBV services, and cervical cancer screening. The exact package of care, range of services, and nature of integration between services differs by country and by service delivery channel depending on factors including the legal context, government policy and provider capacity etc.

IPPF seeks a contractor to take responsibility for the Communications Strategy of this multi-country, integrated Family Planning and Reproductive Health programme. This position will serve to raise awareness about the WISH2ACTION programme goals, objectives and benefits among key public and private stakeholder groups, emphasizing communications support, comprehensive media outreach and publicity; and supporting project partners to share information on core project components.

The contract work shall generally include the following:
a)
column2: New 50 kVa Standby packaged generator set with 24 hour fuel reserve

column1: b)
column2: Installation of changeover panel

column1: c)     Transfer of Supplies
d)     Removal of existing
e)
column2: Testing & Labelling.

column1: f)

The contract work shall generally include the following:
	
a)	New 50 kVa Standby packaged generator set with 24 hour fuel reserve
b)	Installation of changeover panel
c)     Transfer of Supplies 
d)     Removal of existing
e)	Testing & Labelling. 
f)	Earthing. 

The whole of the installation shall be carried out in accordance with the Latest Edition of the IEE Regulations plus amendments.

JLT Speciality Ltd has the sole appointment as insurance brokers to the Authority for the LR portfolio to prepare the ITT document for any LR insurance policies required. 167354746,cf_notices,c1c592c8-cbc2-4914-940d-dbcc287ac5da,ocds-0c46vo-0001-c1c592c8-cbc2-4914-940d-dbcc287ac5da,["tender"],en-GB,ISO Certification,"NLB are certified to BS EN ISO 9001 2015, BS EN ISO14001 2015 and BS EN ISO 45001 2018 (valid until 30 October 2021). The Information and Communication Technology (ICT) department are certified to BS EN 27001 2013 (valid to 7th April 2022).

We require that a transfer / revalidation of these standards is undertaken by the successful bidder at the outset of the contract in order to enable us to maintain our current levels of assurance.  The associated (follow-on) Periodic audits should also be combined / integrated audits,  undertaken by suitably quialfied auditors and approved to audit against 9001,14001 and 45001 management standards, for optimal intergeneration.
With additional audit cycles against 27001 again by suitably qualified certification body.

Full details of the requirements are detailed within the tender documents.",0,GBP,2020-01-07 10:00:31.000000,,2020-01-23 00:00:00.000000,Northern Lighthouse Board,84 George Street ,Edinburgh,,EH2 170950421,cf_notices,dd12dba9-3f9f-438c-adc6-74848e05a5d8,ocds-0c46vo-0001-dd12dba9-3f9f-438c-adc6-74848e05a5d8,["tender"],en-GB,Decontamination Services,"Specialist decontamination cleaning services for Northamptonshire Police, Nottinghamshire Police and Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service. This contract shall be 3 years +1+1

We wish to establish a single Provider contract for the provisions of Decontamination Services. There is a requirement for 24/7 provision of specialist cleaning in respect of a number of chemical, biological and chemical hazards.
The Services shall include specialist cleaning in respect of the following clinical, biological and chemical hazards:
• HIV Hepatitis A, B and C
• Blood
• Fluids
• Excrement
• Saliva
• Scabies
• Weils disease
• CS Spray
• Firearms powder
• Lice
• Fleas

Further information is available at EU Supply with tender ID 38587 https://uk.eu-supply.com",0,GBP,2020-01-23 11:07:20.000000,,2020-02-20 00:00:00.000000,EMSCU Nottinghamshire Police,Nottinghamshire 170502814,cf_notices,5e248ff5-70bb-46d4-b1d2-1631f48d4147,ocds-0c46vo-0001-5e248ff5-70bb-46d4-b1d2-1631f48d4147,["tender"],en-GB,Coaching for GP trainees in targeted strategies to encourage self-reflective and self-directed learning,"The PSU requires a provider who can coach GP trainees in targeted strategies to encourage self-reflective and self-directed learning. The ultimate goal of the support is to improve GP trainee pass rates, specifically targeting the AKT and CSA exams.

This support should be delivered by a provider with substantial knowledge of the exam requirements for GP trainees. They will need to also understand the challenges facing GP trainees throughout their training programme both in hospital and practise environments.

172076668,cf_notices,54a2ef12-435d-4534-ab78-56977fb01d31,ocds-0c46vo-0001-54a2ef12-435d-4534-ab78-56977fb01d31,["tender"],en-GB,"Agriculture, Environment and Animal Care Route Review","The Institute is seeking support to organise and facilitate five regional workshops to feed into the Agriculture, Environment and Animal Care Route Review.

The workshops will supplement our public consultation and ensure we receive a wide range of feedback on the Agriculture, Environment and Animal Care Occupational Map and the standards in scope of the Review.

The workshops will take place after our public consultation has closed, so there will be an opportunity to pick up on any insights from our high-level analysis.  However, the focus should be on getting input from stakeholders who have not responded to our public consultation.

174346057,cf_notices,b2948b7a-5073-4914-b7d4-7a0324ecf38b,ocds-0c46vo-0001-b2948b7a-5073-4914-b7d4-7a0324ecf38b,["tender"],en-GB,TC1007 Framework for Measured and Unmeasured Water Charges,"Manchester City Council is prepared to receive tenders for Measured and Unmeasured Water Charges which will be subject to the information, specification and tender package enclosed.
The purpose of this tender is to appoint one supplier to form a framework water services agreement.
The framework period will be for 1 year with the option to extend for up to an additional 3  years. It is intended for the framework to commence June 2020.

The £20 million value specified in the OJEU notice are for Manchester only and for the potential full 4 years of the framework. The annual value is £5 million. Should other bodies use this framework we expect that the 4 year value will be £30 million.

Justification for Competition with Negotiation as per Regulation 26(4). The needs of the Contracting Authority cannot be met without adaptation of readily available solutions. It requires design and innovation solutions. Due to the infancy of the market, the technical specifications cannot be established with sufficient prevision by the contracting authority with reference to a standard, European Technical Assessment, common technical specification or technical reference.

The high level requirements are:
•Easy to use 'drag and drop' style rostering system
•Integrated system for auto production of pay and billing based on the roster
•System configuration based on each service contract / staff arrangement and means to provide aggregated management information and reporting
•Reconciliation of pay and billing to understand and improve productivity
•Remove onerous spreadsheets to free up front line to focus on quality of services
•Robust data and ability to reconcile outputs to provide meaningful management information
•Automation of pay and billing inputs to improve efficiency and cash flow management

•Significant reduction in manual inputting in back office",0,GBP,2020-02-08 13:40:02.000000,,2020-03-06 00:00:00.000000,Housing 21,Tricorn House 51-53 Tricorn House,Birmingham,,B16 8TP,United 167136884,cf_notices,591e2d22-b16e-4012-9ffb-105f02b1711b,ocds-0c46vo-0001-591e2d22-b16e-4012-9ffb-105f02b1711b,["tender"],en-GB,Chase Farm Parcel C Enabling Works Package,"The site is the former Chase Farmer Hospital, The works include demolition of all structures on parcel C of the site including grubbing up foundations to a depth of 1m below existing ground level. This includes the removal of asbestos within the buildings and externally. In addition to structures above ground, any underground tunnels and ducts are to be removed including any associated foundations and the voids backfilled with MOT type 1 or if instructed selected crushed demolition material. The works also include creating and agreeing with the relevant authorities a remediation plan for any contamination that is on site. This remediation plan is also to be implemented upon instruction to proceed from the Contract Administrator.

176640124,cf_notices,086a068a-3a50-4f44-9aea-443aee11d98b,ocds-0c46vo-0001-086a068a-3a50-4f44-9aea-443aee11d98b,["tender"],en-GB,Dynamic Purchasing Vehicle for Semi-Independent Accommodation and Support,"1)
column2: Floating Support - This is defined as direct support with a young person, supporting them to work towards the outcomes specified by the Contracting Body and those in Section 3 above. It excludes services that include accommodation. Direct support is defined as time that the Provider spends working directly with the young person named within the Individual Service Agreement or attending meetings about the Young Person at the request of the Contracting Body. It excludes 'group work' unless otherwise agreed by the Contracting Body. Such work would typically include: independence training, support with education, employment and training or accompanying young people to appointments. It may also include support to manage tenancies and the development of practical independent living skills.

Accommodation with Support - This is defined as services that deliver both accommodation and support. This Service Level incorporates young people with a multitude of needs and will include a variety of accommodation types. For example, it includes large hostels/foyers as well as single occupancy units. Services can have different staffing/support structures. There is a requirement that there is a minimum of one hour a week of direct support to a specific Young Person.

Supported Lodgings - This is defined as accommodation provided via private individuals ('hosts') who offer one or more rooms in their home on a lodgings basis and, in collaboration with the Provider, offer varying levels of support. It aims to provide a safe and supportive environment and an opportunity to develop skills necessary for independent living.
Parent(s) & Child Support with Accommodation
column3: - This is defined as a service providing accommodation with support to parent(s) aged 16-25 years old and their child(ren). Services must meet all the requirements set out for Service Level 2: Accommodation with Support. The property must be suitable to accommodate children. For example, the bedroom must be large enough to accommodate a child's cot. There must also be access to and space within the property to facilitate a reasonable level of standard baby equipment (i.e. pushchairs, highchairs).

""description"": ""1)	Floating Support - This is defined as direct support with a young person, supporting them to work towards the outcomes specified by the Contracting Body and those in Section 3 above. It excludes services that include accommodation. Direct support is defined as time that the Provider spends working directly with the young person named within the Individual Service Agreement or attending meetings about the Young Person at the request of the Contracting Body. It excludes 'group work' unless otherwise agreed by the Contracting Body. Such work would typically include: independence training, support with education, employment and training or accompanying young people to appointments. It may also include support to manage tenancies and the development of practical independent living skills.

2)	Accommodation with Support - This is defined as services that deliver both accommodation and support. This Service Level incorporates young people with a multitude of needs and will include a variety of accommodation types. For example, it includes large hostels/foyers as well as single occupancy units. Services can have different staffing/support structures. There is a requirement that there is a minimum of one hour a week of direct support to a specific Young Person.

3)	Supported Lodgings - This is defined as accommodation provided via private individuals ('hosts') who offer one or more rooms in their home on a lodgings basis and, in collaboration with the Provider, offer varying levels of support. It aims to provide a safe and supportive environment and an opportunity to develop skills necessary for independent living.

4)	Parent(s) & Child Support with Accommodation	- This is defined as a service providing accommodation with support to parent(s) aged 16-25 years old and their child(ren). Services must meet all the requirements set out for Service Level 2: Accommodation with Support. The property must be suitable to accommodate children. For example, the bedroom must be large enough to accommodate a child's cot. There must also be access to and space within the property to facilitate a reasonable level of standard baby equipment (i.e. pushchairs, highchairs).

CCS is inviting bidders to request to participate in the Automation Marketplace DPS.
This DPS will provide central government and wider public sector departments the opportunity to procure an
extensive range of automated applications. The four (4) distinct elements of the DPS

service filters are; Design (Strategy & Business Transformation), Build (Problem Solving with Tech Solutions), Live (Resource and Training) and Software Licences. If you are successfully appointed to the DPS following your submission you will be invited by customers
(buyers) to submit tenders for relevant services through a call for competition. This DPS remains open for any
supplier to request to participate throughout the duration of the DPS. CCS reserves the right to reduce, extend

177800562,cf_notices,f06f80a1-9ac3-4e8a-a727-e3a85a1ba164,ocds-0c46vo-0001-f06f80a1-9ac3-4e8a-a727-e3a85a1ba164,["tender"],en-GB,Vehicle Locksmith Services,"Currently, the Metropolitan Police Services (MPS) has two internally operated car pounds that are used to store seized and crime related vehicles. MPS Vehicle Recovery and Examination Services (VRES) manage these sites on a daily basis.  Both sites are operated 24/7, 365 days a year and are the forefront of major policing operations.

Vehicles that will require unlocking are mainly vehicles that have been involved in crime and require forensic examination along with a smaller percentage of vehicles, which have been seized by the MPS.
The MPS have three Lots available:

column2: Lot 1 - Perivale Pound and offsite within the MPS area
Lot 2 -  Charlton Pound and offsite within the MPS area
Lot 3 -  Perivale & Charlton Pound and offsite within the MPS area

column1: MPS Area divided into 2 areas; the following boroughs support

column2: Perivale Pound (Lot 1) - Barnet, Brent, Camden, Ealing, Enfield, Hammersmith and Fulham, Harrow, Haringey Hillingdon, Hounslow, Islington, Kensington and Chelsea, Kingston upon Thames,  Merton, Richmond upon Thames, Sutton, Wandsworth, Westminster.
Charlton Pound (Lot 2) - Barking & Dagenham, Bexley, Bromley, Croydon, Greenwich, Hackney, Havering, Lambeth, Lewisham, Newham, Redbridge, Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Waltham Forest.

column1: Proposed contract term: 1st June 2020 - 1st June 2022 +1 year (2+1 years).

177553451,cf_notices,ec72263b-5929-44a5-a299-18f7bb3fa853,ocds-0c46vo-0001-ec72263b-5929-44a5-a299-18f7bb3fa853,["tender"],en-GB,Conference Facilities & Media Centre - COP 26,"The Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) has published the Invitation to Tender (ITT) for COP26 Conferencing Services & Media Centre on Friday 21st February 2020.

To access the ITT, please ensure you have registered as a supplier on the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal at https://fco.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.html and search for project 3653.  Please ensure you  are able to sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA). Please allow up to 24 hours from the point at which you register to the point at which you will be able to access the ITT.

For transparency and audit purposes, all tender related correspondence will strictly be communicated through the portal messaging function. If you experience any difficulties, please contact the Jaggaer helpdesk at 0800 069 8630 or help_UK@jaggaer.com.

The Company has an existing arrangement for small-scale, low-value works up to £15,000 but this contract will cover larger jobs estimated at costing between £15k - £225k.

This current round (issued February 2020) is to appoint 5 Contractors to fill spaces on the existing framework.  Details in the following link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=033376ff-ed80-e711-80e4-005056b64545

177553565,cf_notices,63e97f18-e110-41e5-8162-de25aace689e,ocds-0c46vo-0001-63e97f18-e110-41e5-8162-de25aace689e,["tender"],en-GB,Teviot Estate Regeneration,"Poplar HARCA is procuring a JV development partner to deliver a regeneration scheme to build approximately 1,800 - 2,500 homes at the Teviot Estate site.

The regeneration must protect the close and strong community spirit, and deliver high quality homes, beautiful open spaces that feel welcoming and safe, and suitable infrastructure such as local shops.

Poplar HARCA is responsible for the procurement, but the London Borough of Tower Hamlets (LBTH) is also a named contracting authority as it may later contribute land to the project and rely on the contract to deliver its regeneration outcomes.

Only the land owned by Poplar HARCA is guaranteed within the scope of the contract. The contract will contain provisions which allow for the inclusion of the LBTH at a later date. No exclusivity is granted and it is at the sole discretion of Poplar HARCA and the LBTH to include such land. More information on the possible inclusion of the land is set out in the MOI.",0,GBP,2020-02-21 10:00:57.000000,,2020-04-01 00:00:00.000000,Poplar Housing and Regeneration Community Association 177553566,cf_notices,626b04d8-bb40-44f3-b1ba-7da95eb417ca,ocds-0c46vo-0001-626b04d8-bb40-44f3-b1ba-7da95eb417ca,["tender"],en-GB,GB-Leeds: Z/3783 SCAPE 2.01 - Lab Cooling,"Lab 2.01 experiences temperature fluctuations due mainly to the solar and the appliance heat gains.
Lab temperatures should be maintained at 21C (comfort cooling control conditions) in line with the UoL space heating and cooling policy and the energy management policy.

Initial proposals are to manage the heat gains with a split type "DX" cooling system. Fan coils will be installed within the lab and refrigerant pipe work will connect the indoor units to the outdoor condensing unit(s). 177553440,cf_notices,acef10f5-f69c-4549-bc4d-39a2e5bc9ee9,ocds-0c46vo-0001-acef10f5-f69c-4549-bc4d-39a2e5bc9ee9,["tender"],en-GB,Underwater Bridge Works 2020,"***Please view oppounity available via The Chest    https://www.the-chest.org.uk/    ***                                                                      The County Council is responsible for around 1,800 highway bridges, 1,000 footbridges, over 500 retaining walls and over 900 culverts. Many of these structures are founded below water level and are prone to erosion and scour damage. This was most significantly demonstrated during the storm Desmond floods when a number of bridges were destroyed or needed to be closed due to the severe action of the flood waters.

As part of its capital works programme the Council undertakes routine underwater inspections of a proportion of its structures assets each year to identify and repair any defects that if left unattended could result in structural collapse and risk to the public.

This term contract is for underwater inspection, underwater repairs and debris recovery for bridges and structures across Cumbria. The contract will comprise annual routine inspection and repairs works with additional reactive works commissioned through task orders.
The agreement will be based on the NEC3 term contract amended in accordance with the Highway Maintenance Efficiency Programme guidance.

117 Botchergate""}, ""contactPoint"": {""uri"": ""http://www.cumbria.gov.uk/"", ""name"": ""Clare Redpath"", ""email"": ""clare.redpath@cumbria.gov.uk"", ""faxNumber"": null, ""telephone"": ""+44 1228221746""}}, ""tender"": {""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-da590133-90da-4e61-8fd3-bab7f7f016d3-cum001-dn466484-63289279"", ""items"": [{""id"": 1, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""45221000"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-45221000.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Construction work for bridges and tunnels, shafts and subways""}}], ""title"": ""Underwater Bridge Works 2020"", ""value"": {""amount"": 2000000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""status"": ""unsuccessful"", ""minValue"": {""amount"": 2000000, ""currency"": ""GBP""}, ""documents"": [{""id"": ""tender_url"", ""url"": ""https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/acef10f5-f69c-4549-bc4d-39a2e5bc9ee9"", ""format"": ""text/html"", ""language"": ""en"", ""documentType"": ""tenderNotice""}], ""milestones"": [{""id"": 1, ""title"": ""Contract start"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2020-05-01T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract start date""}, {""id"": 2, ""title"": ""Contract end"", ""status"": null, ""dueDate"": ""2026-04-30T00:00:00Z"", ""description"": ""Anticipated contract end date""}], ""description"": ""***Please view oppounity available via The Chest    https://www.the-chest.org.uk/    ***                                                                      The County Council is responsible for around 1,800 highway bridges, 1,000 footbridges, over 500 retaining walls and over 900 culverts. Many of these structures are founded below water level and are prone to erosion and scour damage. This was most significantly demonstrated during the storm Desmond floods when a number of bridges were destroyed or needed to be closed due to the severe action of the flood waters.
As part of its capital works programme the Council undertakes routine underwater inspections of a proportion of its structures assets each year to identify and repair any defects that if left unattended could result in structural collapse and risk to the public. 
This term contract is for underwater inspection, underwater repairs and debris recovery for bridges and structures across Cumbria. The contract will comprise annual routine inspection and repairs works with additional reactive works commissioned through task orders.
The agreement will be based on the NEC3 term contract amended in accordance with the Highway Maintenance Efficiency Programme guidance.

177553479,cf_notices,04740c82-8a99-4d55-8c0b-96ca2be9a719,ocds-0c46vo-0001-04740c82-8a99-4d55-8c0b-96ca2be9a719,["tender"],en-GB,EV076 Killingworth Sustainable Retrofit Project Sub-Contractor Packages - Block A 01.Asbestos Removal Works,"The Authority has secured funding from the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) for the Killingworth Site Sustainable Retrofit project. This project is a combination of refurbishment and replacement of the existing office accommodation, workshop, welfare and other facilities on the site ensuring it 'future proofs' its operations, with energy efficiency and functionality as the key principles using a range of energy efficient systems, alongside energy generation and energy storage/distribution solutions to support a move to an electronic powered operational fleet. This procurement opportunity relates specifically to the removal of asbestos contaminated partitions and wall linings, debris and floor tile removal and environmental cleaning throughout the building, excluding riser shaft works. North Tyneside Council will be the Principal Contractor for the project therefore tenderers should note that they will be working in the capacity of Sub-Contractor. Tenderers must be aware that this is an operational site and as such Works must be undertaken taking into consideration neighbouring occupied buildings, vehicle movements and office and field-based employees accessing and attending the site in vehicles and on foot. The Block A site is very restrictive for access / plant movements and therefore it is strongly recommended that Tenderers undertake a site visit, contact details to make arrangements are contained within the Preambles document in the tender pack. Tenderers will be required to confirm that they will comply will the Authority's minimum standards in relation to health & safety and mandatory training requirements. All operatives must hold CSCS cards, asbestos awareness training certification and any other trade/task specific relevant qualifications. The Works are programmed to be completed between 03/04/2020 and 01/05/2020.",125000,GBP,2020-02-21 14:51:32.000000,,2020-03-12 00:00:00.000000,North Tyneside Council,"Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North",North Tyneside,,NE27 0BY,England,Paul Batey,paul.batey@northtyneside.gov.uk,+44 1916435611,,,https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/04740c82-8a99-4d55-8c0b-96ca2be9a719,{45262660},2020-02-22 01:31:06.197878,2020-05-08 02:11:13.043437,"{""uri"": ""https://openopps.com/tenders/ocds-0c46vo-0001-04740c82-8a99-4d55-8c0b-96ca2be9a719/?format=json"", ""releases"": [{""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-91bf3755-655b-4c47-9bb9-742df2ee4cb2-345492-ntyn001-dn448416-54393993"", ""tag"": [""tender""], ""date"": ""2020-02-21T14:51:32Z"", ""ocid"": ""ocds-0c46vo-0001-04740c82-8a99-4d55-8c0b-96ca2be9a719"", ""buyer"": {""name"": ""North Tyneside Council"", ""address"": {""region"": null, ""locality"": ""North Tyneside"", ""postalCode"": ""NE27 0BY"", ""countryName"": ""England"", ""streetAddress"": ""Quadrant, Cobalt Business Park The Silverlink North""}, ""contactPoint"": {""uri"": ""http://www.northtyneside.gov.uk/"", ""name"": ""Paul Batey"", ""email"": ""paul.batey@northtyneside.gov.uk"", ""faxNumber"": null, ""telephone"": ""+44 1916435611""}}, ""tender"": {""id"": ""ocds-b5fd17-91bf3755-655b-4c47-9bb9-742df2ee4cb2-ntyn001-dn448416-54393993"", ""items"": [{""id"": 1, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""45262660"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-45262660.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Asbestos-removal work""}}, {""id"": 2, ""description"": ""See description of related tender."", ""classification"": {""id"": ""90650000"", ""uri"": ""http://cpv.data.ac.uk/code-90650000.html"", ""scheme"": ""CPV"", ""description"": ""Asbestos removal services""}}], ""title"": ""EV076 Killingworth Sustainable Retrofit Project Sub-Contractor Packages - 177553478,cf_notices,66c8275e-e2f1-4a00-adcf-ccd6bbbdbaef,ocds-0c46vo-0001-66c8275e-e2f1-4a00-adcf-ccd6bbbdbaef,["tender"],en-GB,007151 - Security for the Hoppings Event,"The Council has a requirement to provide a range of security services which ensure the safe operation of the annual 'Hopping's fair on Newcastle upon Tyne Town Moor. We require an event company to work with the Council and emergency services to make sure the event runs safely and efficiently for the benefit of the public and Show People to deliver the Hopping's fair safely for events from 2020 through to 2022.
The Contract is for an initial 24 month period with 1x12 month option to extend.

177322279,cf_notices,756bc99b-9bc2-471b-a6cf-7d908165ca37,ocds-0c46vo-0001-756bc99b-9bc2-471b-a6cf-7d908165ca37,["tender"],en-GB,"Ship Management Agreement for Dredging Vessell, Sandsend","As the Harbour Authority for Whitby and Scarborough, Scarborough Borough Council has a duty to conserve the harbours so that they are reasonably fit for use as ports, and a duty of reasonable care to maintain the Harbours in a fit condition for vessels to utilise them safely.

It is envisaged an experienced marine company using their specialist knowledge and experience could provide a total management option via a ship management agreement.  Providing a master, relief crew when required and technical and commercial management of the vessel. Delivering a long term solution to recruitment and the ongoing dredging requirements of Scarborough and Whitby.  In line with standard agreements the third party would maintain the vessel to an agreed standard, including its certification and insurance etc. during its operations.

177322488,cf_notices,a0dc4140-f6cf-43d7-a73b-d125c9e2f839,ocds-0c46vo-0001-a0dc4140-f6cf-43d7-a73b-d125c9e2f839,["tender"],en-GB,Framework for Supply & Delivery of Laboratory Tangential Flow Filtration Apparatus & Consumables,"Due to the increase in the nano medicines projects which are being carried out by the CPI's National Formulation Facility as part of the expanding pharmaceutical offering, there is a need to expand our capability to allow product purification, concentration and isolation of the products produced.  This equipment will expand the capability in Formulation by having both hollow fibre and flat sheet methods to clean product.  The equipment must also have a means of operating without constant supervision by incorporating weighing balances to monitor both clean water feed and permeate outputs.  To monitor the process a computer is essential and software that allows the calculation of flux rate would be desirable.",189330,GBP,2020-02-20 15:18:37.000000,,2020-03-06 00:00:00.000000,CENTRE FOR 176865936,cf_notices,9e4130b8-c184-4263-906c-38a5c3fe2338,ocds-0c46vo-0001-9e4130b8-c184-4263-906c-38a5c3fe2338,["tender"],en-GB,Supply and Installation of double glazed aluminium windows at Hindlip CofE Primary School Fernhill Heath Worcester,"Place Partnership Ltd. on behalf of Worcestershire County Council invite suitable, qualified and experienced Window Instalation Contractors to carry out the replacement of windows at Hindlip CofE  Primary School Droitwich Road Fernhill Heath Worcester WR3 8JR
Supply and Installation of double glazed aluminium windows to meet the criteria in the specifications. All windows are to match the profiles previously installed at the school
Site Visits:
Ascertain the nature of the site, access thereto and all local conditions and restrictions likely to affect the execution of the Works.
Arrangements / Appointments for a site visit: Contact the Place Partnership Project Manager:  Steve Wharrad  Mobile. 077100 68908 Email: steve.wharrad@placepartnership.co.uk
Failure to book a site visit appointment will result in access to the site being refused.
The works to be carried out and completed between Monday 6th April 2020 with completion by 24th April 2020.
The form of contract will be the JCT Minor Works Building Contract 2016.
To register your interest or to download all tender documents please visit the Worcestershire County Council e-procurement portal at: www.in-tendhost.co.uk/worcestershire
It is on this basis that we invite suitable contractors to provide a full turn-key project compliant quotation, to deliver this project within set time scales.
All tender documents must be uploaded to the portal by the due date as late returns will not be accepted.
Tenders and supporting documents shall be in English and any contract subsequently entered in to shall be subject to English Law.

Please note that the Supplier is responsible for obtaining all information necessary for the preparation of the tender submission. All cost, expenses and liabilities incurred by the Supplier in connection with the preparation of their submission, the Form of Tender and Pricing Schedule shall be borne by the Supplier.

No tender can be considered to be accepted until such time as the particular tenderer has been notified. If a tender is accepted there will not be a contract until the Authority's offer has been accepted by the tenderer.
Worcestershire County Council reserve the right not to award a contract in full or in part.
